0.title: Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in: Elon Musk
0.article_body: Days after he struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in." Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "Can you buy the moon for me Elon? Earth has lots of wars going on," while another tweeted, "Buy TikTok and delete it."

1.title: Farmers send mango stock to Pune due to rains, prices slashed by 25%
1.article_body: Farmers from Konkan belt have started sending mango stock to Pune Market Yard due to unexpected rains. In last week, over 10,000 boxes of Alphonso mangoes have arrived in Market Yard. Due to increase in supply, prices of these mangoes have been reduced by at least  25%. Sale of mangoes is also increasing as Akshaya Tritiya is approaching.

2.title: 2 men die after falling into sewer pit in Delhi's Bawana
2.article_body: At least two men died after falling into a sewer pit in Delhi's Bawana area on Wednesday, officials said. The men were working near the spot when the accident took place, officials added. "The firemen pulled out the men...sent them to the Maharishi Valmiki Hospital where the doctors declared them brought dead," Delhi Fire Services (DFS) chief Atul Garg said.

3.title: SRH's Umran Malik records best bowling figures of IPL 2022
3.article_body: SRH fast bowler Umran Malik on Wednesday recorded the best bowling figures of IPL 2022. The 22-year-old pacer recorded figures of 4-0-25-5 against GT, registering his first-ever five-wicket haul in T20 cricket. The previous best bowling figures of IPL 2022 (4-0-40-5) were recorded by RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal against KKR on April 18.

4.title: 2-year-old boy dies after being attacked by stray dogs in Hyderabad
4.article_body: A two-year-old boy died after being attacked by a pack of stray dogs in Hyderabad, reports stated. The boy was playing near his house when the dogs attacked and dragged him to adjoining military area on Tuesday night. Meanwhile, locals have alleged that Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) failed to act though stray dogs pose a grave threat to them.

5.title: GT smash 4 sixes in last over to beat SRH on last ball, reclaim top spot on points table
5.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) defeated SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) by five wickets to reclaim the top spot on the IPL 2022 points table. GT chased down the target of 196 on their last delivery. Needing 22 runs in the last over, GT smashed four sixes and scored 25 runs to complete the chase. Rashid Khan slammed an unbeaten 31 off 11 deliveries.

6.title: COVID-19 situation in Karnataka is under control: CM Bommai
6.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said the COVID-19 situation in the state is under control. He added that 2% of international passengers will be randomly tested and teletracking of passengers coming from Australia, Indonesia, New Zealand and South Korea will be carried out. Samples of hospitalised patients who are COVID-19 positive will be sent for genome sequencing, he added.

7.title: Imran Khan begged Pakistani army till last minute to save his govt: Maryam Nawaz
7.article_body: Pakistan's ousted Prime Minister Imran Khan was so desperate that he "begged" the military establishment till the last minute to save his government, Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) Vice President Maryam Nawaz has claimed. "He had even requested former President and PPP co-chairman Asif Ali Zardari to help him in the wake of a no-confidence motion against him," Maryam said.

8.title: James Murdoch's Bodhi Tree partners with Reliance to invest ₹13,500 cr in Viacom18
8.article_body: Reliance and Viacom18 have inked a partnership with Bodhi Tree to turn Viacom18 into "one of the largest TV and digital streaming companies" in India. Bodhi Tree is a platform run by James Murdoch's Lupa Systems and ex-Disney executive Uday Shankar. Reliance's JioCinema will also be transferred to Viacom18 as part of the Bodhi Tree-led ₹13,500-crore investment deal.

9.title: India in talks with Norway wealth fund, GIC over LIC IPO: Report
9.article_body: India is in talks to sign up Norway's sovereign wealth fund and Singapore's GIC Pte as anchor investors for LIC IPO, Bloomberg reported. As per its sources, Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, BlackRock Inc and Fidelity have been approached as well. The Centre is looking to finalise the anchor investor list within days, the report added.

10.title: He removed his bag to accommodate Viv's bag: Vivek Razdan on Kohli's gesture on flight
10.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Vivek Razdan recalled how Virat Kohli once removed his own bag from the overhead locker of a flight in the Caribbean to accommodate the bag of ex-West Indies captain Viv Richards, who was unable to find space. "Kohli...kept his bag below the seat ahead of him," Razdan added. "Richards tapped his shoulder and thanked him," he further said.

11.title: IAS officer booked after IRS officer wife's dowry harassment allegation in MP
11.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh police have filed a case against an Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer after his wife accused him and his family members of dowry harassment. Police said that the woman is an Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officer. “Based on the complaint, a case was registered against the IAS officer, his mother and sister for dowry harassment,” police said.

12.title: 'Major' to release on June 3, will clash with Akshay's 'Prithviraj'
12.article_body: Adivi Sesh-starrer 'Major' has been postponed again and now will release on June 3. Previously, the film was slated to release on May 27. However, the actor announced on Twitter that the release has been pushed by a week. The film's release date had earlier been postponed due to the pandemic. The film will now clash with Akshay Kumar's 'Prithviraj'.

13.title: Your rules won't apply here: EU to Musk over Twitter deal
13.article_body: The European Union has warned that Elon Musk-owned Twitter will have to respect the bloc's rules regarding online content moderation. "Elon, there are rules...It's not your rules which will apply here," said EU Internal Market Chief Thierry Breton. He added that if Twitter fails to comply, the EU could fine 6% of its annual revenue or even ban it entirely.

14.title: Bomb threat letter found at railway station in Punjab's Kapurthala
14.article_body: A bomb threat letter was found at Sultanpur Lodhi Railway Station in Punjab's Kapurthala on Wednesday, ANI reported. The letter mentioned that major railway stations like Sultanpur Lodhi, Ferozepur and Jalandhar will be blown up by May 21 to avenge, ANI quoted the Station Master as saying. It also reportedly mentioned that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann will also be attacked.

15.title: ₹1 lakh ex-gratia to those severely injured in Thanjavur incident
15.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin met those who were injured in the Thanjavur electrocution incident and announced ex-gratia of ₹1 lakh to those severely injured and ₹50,000 to the injured. "It is a tragic and painful incident. We have ordered officials to take action on this issue," he said. Eleven people were killed and 15 were injured in the incident.

16.title: I wish Musk the very best, our social media rules remain unchanged: MoS IT
16.article_body: Rajeev Chandrasekhar, the Union Minister of State (MoS) for Electronics and Information Technology, told ET, "I wish Elon Musk the very best," as the world's richest person struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion. He added that the government's goals and expectations of accountability and safety rules for all social media intermediaries, including Twitter, remain the same.

17.title: Man Utd's Rangnick accepts top-four finish in PL is not 'realistic'
17.article_body: Manchester United's interim manager Ralf Rangnick accepts that a top-four finish in the Premier League this season is not "realistic" ahead of their Premier League clash with Chelsea on Thursday. United are currently sixth on the table with 54 points with four games left. "Even if we win all four games, it's still not in our own hands," Rangnick said.

18.title: Australian minister accuses China of interference ahead of federal polls
18.article_body: Australian minister Karen Andrews on Wednesday suggested that China deliberately announced its security pact with Solomon Islands ahead of Australian federal polls in a bid to derail Liberal Party's re-election. She further claimed that China wants the Labor Party to win elections. Notably, Labor Party has claimed that Australian government's inability to stall pact is a foreign policy failure.

19.title: India has one language, which is entertainment: Sonu Sood on national language debate
19.article_body: Sonu Sood spoke about the ongoing debate on whether Hindi can be considered the national language of the country. "I don't think Hindi can be called just the national language. India has one language, which is entertainment," he said. "It doesn't really matter which industry you belong to. If you entertain people, they will love you...and accept you," Sonu added.

20.title: Danish teenager Rune beats world no. 3 Zverev in Munich
20.article_body: Danish teenager Holger Rune on Wednesday beat world number three Alexander Zverev 6-3, 6-2 at the ATP 250 tournament in Munich. "I have a lot of respect for him, and I obviously didn't expect to win in two sets, and with a score like this," the 18-year-old said. Rune's victory over Zverev is his first against a Top 10 opponent.

21.title: Opp'n hasn't reduced VAT on fuel, BJP did months before: Minister
21.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that the Opposition ruled states have not reduced taxes on fuel, despite BJP-led states having done it months before. "Opposition only looks at the Centre but does not reduce the taxes in their own states. Don't they want to benefit the people who voted them to power?" he said.

22.title: Indonesia widens export ban to include crude and refined palm oil
22.article_body: Indonesia has widened the scope of its export ban on raw materials for cooking oil to include crude and refined palm oil, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said on Wednesday. In a separate statement, President Joko Widodo said people's need for affordable food trumped revenue concerns. Export ban will be lifted once domestic needs are met, Widodo said.

23.title: Reliance, Apollo Global plan joint bid for UK pharma chain Boots: Report
23.article_body: Reliance Industries and US-based Apollo Global Management are planning a joint bid for UK's high street pharmacy chain Boots, the Financial Times reported. Both would own equity stakes in Boots under the plan, however, it's unclear whether the size of their stakes would be the same. Boots' US parent Walgreens Boots Alliance put the business for sale in December 2021.

24.title: Web space gave me visibility like never before: Sikandar Kher
24.article_body: Actor Sikandar Kher has said the OTT platform gave him visibility that he never got before. "As an actor, you need and want people to see your work and your abilities," he stated. "When you get that many eyeballs, filmmakers also get the chance to view you in their projects and the characters they create," Sikandar further added.

25.title: We need to take more chances: Foden on CL SF clash with Real Madrid
25.article_body: Phil Foden admitted Manchester City needed to "take more chances" after their Champions League semi-final first-leg clash on Tuesday. City won 4-3 despite having a two-goal advantage on three occasions. "It was a great game. End to end. We started really well and could have killed them off. In these games, we need to take more chances," Foden said.

26.title: World no.1 Swiatek withdraws from Madrid Open with shoulder injury
26.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek has withdrawn from the Madrid Open due to a right shoulder injury. "I need a break from playing so intensively in order to treat my arm well and that's why, unfortunately, I have to withdraw," the 20-year-old said. Swiatek is on a 23-match unbeaten streak after winning her fourth consecutive title in Stuttgart on Sunday.

27.title: Finnish, Swedish security services warn of Russian interference amid NATO bid
27.article_body: Finland and Sweden must be vigilant of Russian spy operations and cyber attacks as they consider NATO membership bid, nordic countries' intelligence chiefs said on Wednesday. The announcement comes amid reports that the countries may apply to join alliance in May. Russia has warned of deploying nuclear weapons and hypersonic missiles in Baltic enclave of Kaliningrad if they join NATO.

28.title: No longer good enough to supply defensive weapons to Ukraine: Truss
28.article_body: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss on Tuesday said it is no longer good enough for Britain to supply only defensive weapons to Ukraine against its war with Russia. "For too long, there was a false distinction between defensive and offensive weapons. It became an excuse for some to drag their feet. That time has now passed," she said.

29.title: EU tiggers rule of law mechanism against Hungarian government
29.article_body: The EU on Wednesday launched its rule of law mechanism against the Hungarian government that could strip Hungary of its EU funding. The mechanism allows the EU to withhold funds from member states if they are found to have committed violations against the EU's democratic standards. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen criticised "corruption" in Hungary earlier this month.

30.title: Won't do too many dance numbers, it's a matter of being typecast: Regina
30.article_body: Actress Regina Cassandra, who has a dance number in 'Acharya', said she would not do too many of them in the future. "A few years ago, I was offered a song with Chiranjeevi. After that, I got many more offers to do item numbers," she stated. "Makers felt...why can't I do it in another? It's...matter of being typecast," Regina added.

31.title: Paying for Russian gas in roubles breaches sanctions: EU chief
31.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday said paying for Russian gas in roubles would breach sanctions imposed on Russia. "We have about 97% of all contracts that explicitly stipulate payments in euros or dollars," she said. Unless a supply contract was denominated in roubles, European firms should not accede to Russia's demands, she added.

32.title: 1 dead, 24 missing after migrant boat capsizes off Canary Islands
32.article_body: Authorities said a boat carrying 61 migrants capsized off Spain's Canary Islands leaving one person dead and 24 missing. Spain's marine services rescued 36 people, including two minors and 10 women, and recovered the body of a woman. A spokeswoman said three boats in total were intercepted. A total of 116 people were rescued from the other two boats.

33.title: 36th Russian colonel killed in Ukraine since invasion began
33.article_body: Lieutenant Colonel Oleg Yevseev is the 36th Russian colonel to be killed in Ukraine since Russia's invasion began on February 24. Russia did not provide details on how or when he died. Yevseev was a commander of the 291st Artillery Brigade of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation. At least 36 colonels and eight generals have died so far.

34.title: COVID-19 is now at an endemic stage, not pandemic: Mexican govt
34.article_body: The Mexican government said COVID-19 is no longer a pandemic but has passed to an endemic stage in Mexico. "It is now retreating almost completely," President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said. Mexico has recorded almost 325,000 COVID-19 related deaths since the pandemic began, although government reviews of death certificates suggest the actual death toll could be about 490,000.

35.title: GT's Lockie Ferguson bowls most expensive 20th over in IPL 2022
35.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) fast bowler Lockie Ferguson on Wednesday bowled the most expensive 20th over in an IPL 2022 match after conceding 25 runs against SRH. Ferguson was hit for four sixes in the over, out of which three were hit by Shashank Singh. Ferguson recorded bowling figures of 4-0-52-0 in the match.

36.title: 14-yr-old gets pregnant after being raped by 5 Russian soldiers, plans to keep the baby
36.article_body: A 14-year-old girl is pregnant after being raped by five Russian soldiers in Ukraine, said reports. The teenager, from Bucha, plans to keep the child after doctors warned if she had an abortion now she may not be able to have children again. Her story has been shared by psychologist Oleksandra Kvitko, who is helping her accept the child.

37.title: Ukraine still in control of majority of its airspace: UK
37.article_body: Britain's Ministry of Defence on Wednesday said Ukraine remains in control of the majority of its airspace as Russia has failed to "effectively destroy" Ukraine's air force. They said Ukraine's air defences have also not been "suppressed" by Russian forces which first invaded Ukraine on February 24. "Ukraine continues to hold Russian air assets at risk," they added.

38.title: Will take considerate view on crypto, it can't be rushed: FM
38.article_body: The government will take a considerate decision on cryptocurrency regulation but it can't be rushed through, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. However, she added that the government is open to promote innovation made in the distributed ledger technologies. "Our intention is in no way to hurt this (innovation around crypto)...but (we need to) define for ourselves," she stated.

39.title: Rashid Khan records his 3rd most expensive spell in IPL
39.article_body: GT leg-spinner Rashid Khan on Wednesday recorded his third-most expensive spell in IPL. The 23-year-old gave away 45 runs against SRH, registering figures of 4-0-45-0. Rashid was hit for three sixes and two fours in his spell. Rashid's most expensive spell in IPL had come on April 19, 2018, when he conceded 55 runs against PBKS while representing SRH.

40.title: US considers imposing sanctions against Putin's alleged girlfriend: Reports
40.article_body: The US is reportedly considering imposing sanctions against Alina Kabaeva, the woman it believes is Russian President Vladimir Putin's girlfriend and mother of at least three of his children. The WSJ claimed that earlier, the US spared Kabaeva from Russian sanctions in a "last-minute" decision. Russia's 38-year-old politician Kabaeva is a retired Olympic gold medal winner in rhythmic gymnastics.

41.title: Travis Scott to publicly perform for 1st time since Astroworld tragedy
41.article_body: Travis Scott will be performing publicly for the first time since the Astroworld tragedy that took place in November last year and killed 10 people. The rapper will be performing in Miami on May 7 at E11even during the 'Race Week' ahead of the F1 Grand Prix race. E11even's website has begun the sale for the tickets for Scott's event.

42.title: 26-yr-old woman beats 3-yr-old son to death in Raj, arrested
42.article_body: A 26-year-old woman was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly beating her three-and-a-half-year-old son to death in Chhipabarod town of Baran district, police said. The woman beat her son at their house bolting the room from inside, Chhipabarod Police Station SHO Ravinder Singh said. The accused was arrested after her husband, Anil Jatav, filed a police report against her.

43.title: McLaren's Ricciardo apologises to Ferrari's Sainz after 1st lap crash
43.article_body: McLaren's Daniel Ricciardo apologised to Ferrari's Carlos Sainz after causing a collision in the first lap of the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix last Sunday. Ricciardo finished the race in 18th place. "Obviously not the way I wanted Sunday to go. A painful one and obviously not the way I want to affect somebody else's race," Ricciardo said.

44.title: Destroyed 'large batch' of Western-supplied arms in Ukraine: Russia
44.article_body: Russian forces have destroyed a large quantity of foreign weapons in southeastern Ukraine with long-range missiles, the country's defence ministry said on Wednesday. According to the ministry, the destroyed weapons were supplied by the US and European countries for Ukrainian troops. This comes after the US and 40 other nations held a security summit to discuss arms supplies to Ukraine.

45.title: Russia bans 287 UK lawmakers from entering country amid Ukraine war
45.article_body: Russia on Wednesday placed sanctions on 287 lawmakers from the UK's lower house of parliament and banned them from entering the country amid the ongoing Ukraine invasion. "These persons...contribute(d) to the groundless whipping up of Russophobic hysteria in the UK," a statement from Russia's foreign ministry read. Russia's move came after the UK imposed sanctions on 386 Russian parliamentarians.

46.title: NDMA issues guidelines for COVID-19 death compensation
46.article_body: The National Disaster Management Authority on Wednesday issued guidelines for those wanting compensation for the death of a family member due to COVID-19. The guideline said that those wanting compensation will have to file the application by May 23 and all COVID-19 deaths that have occurred before March 20, 2022, are eligible to apply for compensation.

47.title: Labour Ministry calls Infosys for discussion on non-compete clause
47.article_body: The Labour Ministry issued a notice to Infosys to hold a joint discussion on April 28 regarding the enforcement of the non-compete agreement. The agreement bans ex-employees from working for same customers in rival firms for six months. This comes after Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES), an IT union, filed a complaint with the Ministry seeking the clause's removal.

48.title: I'm able to make choices in films because of my family's work: Harsh
48.article_body: Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor, speaking about his films' choices, has said, "The reason I can make the choices that I've done is because of the work...they (his family) have done." "I'm secure...Financially, emotionally...I'm able to make those choices. So, thanks to the work that the family has done for so many decades," he further added. Harsh will feature in 'Thar'.

49.title: BJP and CPI(M) are trying to defame West Bengal: Mamata Banerjee
49.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that the law and order situation in West Bengal was under control and accused some sections of media of spreading misinformation. "A suicide case was turned into a rape case. BJP and CPI(M) are both trying to defame Bengal," Mamata Banerjee said. We will not let Bengal become Hathras or Unnao, she added.

50.title: Shooting of 'Scam 2003' begins, Hansal Mehta shares pic from the sets
50.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta took to Instagram and said the shooting of 'Scam 2003' has begun. Hansal shared an image of the clapboard and wrote, "And we rolled today." 'Scam 2003' will be directed by Tushar Hiranandani. Hansal had directed 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story'. The series will be tentatively named 'Scam 2003: The Curious Case of Abdul Karim Telgi'.

51.title: 6,000 loudspeakers removed, volume of 30,000 speakers lowered in UP
51.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police said that over 6,000 unauthorised loudspeakers were removed from religious places across the state. The volume of other 30,000 loudspeakers was set to permissible limits following a government order, the police added. Prashant Kumar, ADGP (Law and Order), said, "Orders of the High Court regarding loudspeakers are also being considered during the exercise."

52.title: Kejriwal stretches during meet with PM Modi, video goes viral
52.article_body: A video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal stretching and sitting in a relaxed manner with his hands behind his head during PM Narendra Modi's meet with Chief Ministers on COVID-19 situation has gone viral. Sharing the video, BJP criticised Kejriwal and called him "mannerless". "Arvind Kejriwal continues to disgrace himself with uncouth mannerism," tweeted BJP's Amit Malviya.

53.title: BJP-led NDA govt has failed, is a 'non-performing asset': KTR
53.article_body: TRS Working President KT Rama Rao on Wednesday said the BJP-led NDA government has failed on all fronts and has become a "non-performing asset". Even though the NDA government talked about "Aatmanirbhar Bharat" (self-reliant India), there has been no improvement in the living standards of the people, Rao said. TRS should play a key role in national politics, he added.

54.title: Without Gandhi family, there would be no Congress: AK Antony
54.article_body: Senior Congress leader AK Antony on Wednesday stated that the Nehru-Gandhi family is the powerhouse of Congress, without whom, the party wouldn't exist. "Without Congress' role, you cannot think of...change of guard in Delhi," Antony added. His remarks come a day after poll strategist Prashant Kishor declined to join the party, citing a need for leadership overhaul in Congress.

55.title: Electricity deliberately curtailed during sehri & iftar: Ex J&K CM
55.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Wednesday said electricity is deliberately being curtailed at sehri and iftar hours to hassle the Muslim population observing the holy month of Ramadan. He also weighed in on the loudspeaker row and said, "Why can't loudspeakers be allowed at mosques when they're being used in other places?"

56.title: PM wants startup founders to come from tier 2, 3 cities: MoS IT
56.article_body: PM Modi wants the next wave of startup founders to come from tier 2 and tier 3 cities, Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said. He stated, "It's a 100% policy objective [that] digital opportunities are equally available...in Ghaziabad, Jharkhand, Srinagar, Kohima...as much...in Bengaluru." Once 5G gets rolled out, youngsters will "itch" to get into technology sector, he added.

57.title: Constitute a grievance board: Delhi HC to AIIMS over nurses' strike
57.article_body: After All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) nurses called off their strike last night, the Delhi High Court has asked AIIMS to constitute a board for hearing grievances of the employees. "Do not take immediate action. Let things cool down. Take undertaking, set up a board," Justice Yashwant Varma directed AIIMS. You have to strike a balance, he added.

58.title: Apple opens Self Service Repair to iPhone users in US
58.article_body: Apple on Wednesday announced the launch of Self Service Repair in the US. As part of the facility, owners of iPhone 12, 13 and third-generation SE can go through repair manuals, and then buy the parts required to fix common issues with the handsets online. The service will be expanded to additional countries, starting with Europe, later this year.

59.title: Obama loses, Bolsonaro gains followers as Musk buys Twitter: Report
59.article_body: Barack Obama lost 3,00,000 followers while Katy Perry and Taylor Swift lost 2,00,000 and 1,00,000 followers respectively after Elon Musk bought Twitter on Monday, NBC reported. Meanwhile, right-wing politicians including Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro and US Representative Marjorie Greene gained several followers. Responding to the report, Twitter said the "fluctuations" were "organic".

60.title: State govt can't be blamed: Maha CM on PM's remark on high fuel prices
60.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday said the state government can't be held responsible for rising fuel prices. He said Maharashtra gets only 5.5% of central taxes even though it contributes 38.3% to direct taxes and 15% to India's GST revenue. This comes after PM Narendra Modi requested several states, including Maharashtra, to cut VAT on petrol and diesel.

61.title: Xiaomi launches Xiaomi 12 Pro 5G in India at starting price of ₹62,999
61.article_body: Xiaomi has launched the Xiaomi 12 Pro 5G in India at a starting price of ₹62,999. The smartphone is equipped with Snapdragon® 8 Gen 1, a 50MP triple rear camera and 4,600 mAh battery that supports 120W fast charging, and comes in the colours Couture Blue, Noir Black and Olive Mauve. The sale will go live on May 2.

62.title: Kirit Somaiya received minor injuries when attacked by Sena workers: Police
62.article_body: Mumbai police said that BJP's Kirit Somaiya received minor injuries after he was attacked by Shiv Sena workers. They added, "Bhabha Hospital in Bandra which treated Kirit Somaiya following the attack stated, 'It was not a major injury. There was minimal bleeding'." Somaiya was attacked when he went to meet MP Navneet Rana and her husband at Khar police station.

63.title: Hindustan Unilever's profit rises 8.6% YoY to ₹2,327 crore in Q4
63.article_body: Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) on Wednesday reported an 8.6% rise in its profit after tax from ₹2,143 crore in Q4 FY21 to ₹2,327 crore in Q4 FY22. Its profit in FY22 rose 10.9% YoY to ₹8,818 crore. The company said its revenue from sale of products  in Q4 FY22 came in at ₹13,190 crore, up 10.40% YoY from ₹11,947 crore.

64.title: Delhi reports 1,367 new COVID-19 cases, 14% higher than yesterday
64.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 1,367 new COVID-19 cases, 14% more than 1,204 fresh cases reported a day ago. As many as 1,042 recoveries and one death from COVID-19 were reported in the last 24 hours. The positivity rate slightly dipped to 4.5% on Wednesday from 4.64% a day ago, according to the Delhi government's daily COVID-19 bulletin.

65.title: WB spent ₹1,500 cr to subsidise fuel prices: CM after fuel price meet
65.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday criticised PM Narendra Modi who urged states to reduce VAT and said that her government has spent ₹1,500 crore in the last three years to subsidise fuel prices. "Today's interaction with PM Modi was completely one-sided and misleading. The facts shared by him were wrong," she said

66.title: Mamata will be real game-changer in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: Sinha
66.article_body: Newly-elected Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Shatrughan Sinha praised party supremo Mamata Banerjee and claimed that she could be "real game-changer" in 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Sinha, who won from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency in bypoll, stated that Banerjee is "tried and tested leader who's respected by all". He added that he had left BJP as party turned into an autocracy.

67.title: Kiccha Sudeep responds after Devgn tweets 'Hindi will always be our national language'
67.article_body: Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep responded after Ajay Devgn tweeted that Hindi will "always be our national language" following Sudeep's remark that Hindi is "no more" a national language. "The context to why I said that...is...different," he said, adding he "respects every language". "No offense sir...but was wondering what'd the situation be if my response was typed in Kannada!!" he stated.

68.title: Temperatures rising earlier than usual in country, fire cases rising: PM warns CMs
68.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while interacting with CMs of various states on the COVID-19 situation, said that he'd like to discuss "one more topic". "Temperatures in the country are rising rapidly...and these temperatures are rising earlier than usual...the incidents of fire are increasing," the PM warned. "I request all states to conduct safety audits of hospitals on priority," the PM added.

69.title: Bilawal Bhutto Zardari takes oath as Pak's youngest foreign minister
69.article_body: Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari took oath as 37th Foreign Minister of Pakistan on Wednesday. Bilawal, 33, who was administered oath by President Arif Alvi at Aiwan-i-Sadr (President's House), is reportedly the country's youngest foreign minister. Bilawal was first elected to National Assembly in 2018 but this is the first time he's been inducted into federal cabinet.

70.title: Proud to be sanctioned: UK lawmaker as Russia bars entry to 287 UK MPs
70.article_body: After Russia imposed personal restrictions on 287 UK MPs and banned them from entering the country, senior UK lawmaker Mark Harper said he's proud to be on the list. "Russia really hates being called out for their illegal invasion of Ukraine and disgraceful war crimes," Harper tweeted. Notably, Russia has accused the 287 sanctioned-UK MPs of fuelling "unwarranted Russophobic hysteria".

71.title: Machine Gun Kelly & I consume each other's blood during rituals: Megan
71.article_body: Actress Megan Fox said she and her fiance Machine Gun Kelly consume each other's blood during rituals. "It's just a few drops, but...we do consume each other's blood on occasion for ritual purposes only," Megan stated. "Kelly's much more haphazard...hectic and chaotic, where he's willing to...cut his chest open with broken glass and be like, 'Take my soul'," she added.

72.title: GT to bowl first after SRH lose toss for 1st time in IPL 2022, Washington returns
72.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bowl first against SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) in their IPL 2022 match on Wednesday. It is the first time that SRH have lost a toss in IPL 2022. SRH have made one change to their playing XI, with Washington Sundar returning after recovering from an injury.

73.title: Kamal Haasan pays his condolences to the families of Thanjavur victims
73.article_body: Kamal Haasan paid his condolences to the families of the victims after 11 people died due to electrocution in Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu after a temple chariot came in contact with an electric wire. "District administration...police...local administration should...take...precautionary measures with the festival organizers at such gatherings," Kamal tweeted. 15 people were injured due to the incident.

74.title: Actor Chiranjeevi seen clicking actor-son Ram Charan's pics with fans; people react
74.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi was seen clicking his actor-son Ram Charan's photos with the latter's fans in a video that is doing rounds on social media. The video of the father-son duo of actors was taken when they were attending a promotional event. Several Twitter users reacted to the video with tweets like, "Proud moment for father," and "It's a lifetime moment."

75.title: Which Indians have taken the most wickets in T20 cricket?
75.article_body: With his three-wicket haul against RCB, RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin took his tally of wickets in T20 cricket to 271, becoming the highest wicket-taker among Indians in T20 cricket. He overtook Piyush Chawla, who has taken 270 wickets. Yuzvendra Chahal is the third-highest wicket-taker among Indians with 265 wickets, followed by Amit Mishra (262 wickets).

76.title: Russia quits UN tourism body ahead of vote on its suspension: UNWTO
76.article_body: United Nations' World Tourism Organisation (UNWTO) Secretary-General Zurab Pololikashvili on Wednesday said that Russia is withdrawing from the UN's tourism body. Taking to Twitter, Zurab said, "Today, Russia announced their intention to withdraw from UNWTO." The announcement comes ahead of a vote by UNWTO's executive council to suspend Moscow's membership over its invasion of Ukraine.

77.title: Cong revamps Haryana unit, appoints Udai Bhan as state party chief
77.article_body: Congress on Wednesday revamped its Haryana unit and named four-time legislator Udai Bhan as the new state party chief. Bhan replaced Kumari Selja, who tendered her resignation to Congress' high command recently and described herself as a "true soldier" of the party. Additionally, Congress appointed Shruti Choudhry, Ram Kishan Gujjar, Jitender Kumar Bhardwaj and Suresh Gupta as working presidents.

78.title: Won't happen here: T'gana CM as K'taka minister quits over contractor's death
78.article_body:
A few days after Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa resigned over a contractor's death, Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao said that such an incident would not take place in Telangana. 
"We have seen a minister losing his ministry in Karnataka but that will not happen in Telangana," KCR said. Contractor Santosh Patil was found dead at a hotel in Udupi.

79.title: Fire due to MCD's negligence: Gopal Rai over Bhalswa fire
79.article_body: A day after a massive fire broke out at Bhalswa landfill in Delhi, Environment Minister Gopal Rai accused the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) of negligence. "The people of Delhi are facing landfill fire due to MCD's negligence and 15 years of BJP's corruption," he said. The Delhi Pollution Control Committee has been asked to submit a report, he added.

80.title: UP official asked to serve mid-day meals to students for delaying RTI reply
80.article_body: In a "symbolic punishment", UP State Information Commission has reportedly asked a Public Information Officer to serve mid-day meals to over 200 students of a primary school in Ghazipur. The punishment was announced after Chandrika Prasad, PIO of Noonra village, delayed in replying to an RTI application. Prasad will have to submit a video of the act to the commission.

81.title: BBMP or BESCOM, no one will be spared: K'taka CM Basavaraj Bommai
81.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai assured probe into the case where a 22-year-old man was electrocuted in Bengaluru and said that no one, be it BBMP or BESCOM, will be spared. "I have asked police officers to probe the matter and we will take necessary action," he said. He added that compensation will be given as per the electricity department norms.

82.title: Video shows Putin's hand shaking uncontrollably amid rumours of Parkinson's disease
82.article_body: Rumours of Russian President Vladimir Putin's failing health have emerged after video footage seemed to show him suffering tremors. New footage of a meeting between him and his Belarusian ally Aleksandr Lukashenko shows Putin hold his arm to his chest in an apparent effort to stop his hand from shaking violently. Rumours have suggested he may have Parkinson's disease.

83.title: Hyd Customs seize gold worth ₹86 lakh concealed in undergarments
83.article_body: Hyderabad Customs officials detected and seized 1614 grams of gold valued at ₹86.42 lakh from a female passenger, who had arrived from Dubai. The officials found gold in paste form concealed in her undergarments. In another incident, customs officials on April 6 had seized gold worth ₹24.820 lakh concealed in a man's trousers and undergarments.

84.title: Tragedy beyond words: President Kovind on electrocution deaths in TN
84.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Wednesday condoled the loss of lives because of electrocution in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur, saying it is a tragedy beyond words. Eleven people, including children, were electrocuted during a temple chariot procession when it came in contact with a high tension transmission line. "I pray for the speedy recovery of the injured," President Kovind tweeted.

85.title: Uniform Civil Code should be implemented, RPI (A) backs it: Athawale
85.article_body: Union Minister and Republican Party of India (A) supremo Ramdas Athawale said on Wednesday that party backs Uniform Civil Code (UCC) and will support it when it's tabled in parliament. "I think...there should be a common law for all," he added. Athawale's remarks come amid the proposed implementation of the UCC by some BJP-ruled states, including Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh.

86.title: Is it proper to use 'jumla' for PM: Delhi HC on Khalid's bail plea
86.article_body: While hearing the bail application of student activist Umar Khalid, the Delhi High Court on Wednesday asked whether it was proper to use the term 'jumla' regarding the PM of India. The court said that a "lakshman rekha" has to be there for criticising the government. "Criticism of the government cannot become a crime," said senior advocate Trideep Pais.

87.title: Actor Kenneth Tsang found dead in Hong Kong's COVID-19 quarantine hotel
87.article_body: Kenneth Tsang, the 86-year-old veteran Hong Kong actor who was also a familiar face on Singapore television, was found dead on Wednesday at a hotel in Hong Kong. He was undergoing the city's mandatory travel quarantine for COVID-19 at the hotel after returning from Singapore on Monday, reports said. He had tested negative for COVID-19 on Tuesday, the reports added.

88.title: Australian inflation hits 20-yr high, petrol prices rise 35%
88.article_body: Australia's annual inflation rate hit 5.1% in Q1 2022, from 3.5% the previous quarter and the highest rate since 2001. While petrol prices gained 35%, cost of new dwellings climbed a record 13.7% and food prices also picked up. This could make the Reserve Bank of Australia raise interest rates from record lows ahead of the federal election, Reuters reported.

89.title: Indian photographer's pic of Srinagar kebab seller wins int'l food photo contest
89.article_body: Indian photographer Debdatta Chakraborty has been named the overall winner of Pink Lady Food Photographer of the Year 2022. Titled 'Kebabiyana', the photograph taken in Srinagar showed a kebab seller on a busy street at night. "This image, gentle but powerful, nourishes our soul," Caroline Kenyon, the founder of the award, said.

90.title: 2016 EgyptAir flight crash that killed 66 caused by pilot's lit cigarette, probe finds
90.article_body: The 2016 EgyptAir flight crash that killed 66 was caused by a pilot smoking a cigarette, an investigation found. The Airbus A320 plane was travelling from France to Egypt in May 2016 when it crashed into the sea south of Crete. The cigarette inadvertently ignited oxygen leaking from an emergency gas mask leading to the fire and crash, probe found.

91.title: 3 students critical as lift collapses at IMS college in Ghaziabad
91.article_body: At least eight students were injured after the lift they were in collapsed at an engineering college in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. Three students are said to be critical. "Eight students reported injuries after a lift fell in the IMS college in Dasna, Ghaziabad," a senior police official said. He added that all students were admitted to a nearby hospital.

92.title: ED attaches ₹6.17 cr of fintech firms linked to Chinese nationals
92.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has provisionally attached ₹6.17 crore lying in bank and payment gateway accounts linked to fintech firms and individuals, including Chinese nationals, accused of lending money at usurious rates during the pandemic. According to ED, the accused issued loans and raised investments through mobile apps. The firms were registered on Chinese nationals' instructions.

93.title: PM quoting only Opposition-ruled states to reduce VAT on fuel: DMK
93.article_body: DMK's TKS Elangovan accused PM Narendra Modi of quoting only opposition-ruled states to reduce taxes on fuel. "[PM Modi] won't say that Gujarat or Karnataka should reduce taxes," Elangovan said. This comes after PM Modi urged governments of Maharashtra, West Bengal, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Jharkhand and Tamil Nadu to reduce VAT on fuel during his meeting with the CMs.

94.title: It's any actress' dream: Urvashi Rautela on sharing screen with SRK
94.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela was recently spotted at Baba Siddique's Iftar party, which was also attended by celebrities including Shah Rukh Khan. When asked if she'd like to work with actor Shah Rukh Khan, Urvashi said, "I would really wish and wait for the opportunity to share screen opposite Shahrukh Khan. It's any actress' dream. Hope that happens soon."

95.title: Shweta responds to trolls in new post, asks 'Tere baap ka kya jaata hai'
95.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari has responded to trolls who question her for laughing too much in pictures with a new post on Instagram. The actress shared pictures of herself laughing and captioned it, "They (trolls): 'Itna kya hans rahi hai! (Why are you laughing so much) Us: 'tere Baap ka kya jaata hai (what has your father got to lose)'."

96.title: Russia-backed Moldovan breakaway region says shots fired from Ukraine
96.article_body: Moldova's pro-Russian breakaway region of Transdniestria claimed on Wednesday that shots from Ukraine were fired towards its village Cobasna, which houses an ammunition depot. Transdniestria further claimed that several Ukrainian drones had been detected flying over Cobasna. This comes days after Moldova accused Russia of seeking to recruit its citizens from the region to fight in Ukraine war.

97.title: Don't oppose every step just to appear on TV: Mann to Opposition
97.article_body: Reacting to Opposition's criticism on Knowledge Sharing Agreement signed between Delhi-Punjab government, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said, "Opposition parties should not oppose every step being taken just to appear on TV." "Opposition parties should give us time," he added. "Navjot Singh Sidhu is questioning us on Power Purchase Agreements. When he was made Power Minister, he ran away," Mann said.

98.title: Malaysia to lift COVID-19 curbs including outdoor mask rule from May
98.article_body: Malaysia's Health Minister Khairy Jamaluddin on Wednesday said that the country will ease more COVID-19 restrictions, including scrapping the need to wear masks outdoors from the start of May. He, however, said that masks will remain mandatory for indoor activities and on public transport. People will now be able to enter public premises regardless of their vaccination status, Jamaluddin added.

99.title: Ram Charan visits Vijayawada's Kanakadurgamma Temple ahead of Acharya's release
99.article_body: Ram Charan and director Koratala Siva visited the Kanakadurgamma Temple in Vijayawada to offer prayers before Acharya's release on April 29. While the 'RRR' actor wore an all-black kurta pyjama look yet again, Siva was clicked in a semi-formal look with a shirt and denim. Yesterday, actors Chiranjeevi and Ram Charan were spotted in Hyderabad to promote 'Acharya'.

100.title: There's no action hero of my age in H'wood, want to try my luck there: Tiger
100.article_body: Tiger Shroff said there's a void in terms of a young action hero in Hollywood, adding "[There are] Tom Cruise and Jackie Chan, but there isn't any action hero...of my age group." "It's been a while since [I've] seen somebody with that skill set...portraying action or the kind of action I do...But that's my goal...to...try my luck in...Hollywood," he said.

101.title: Greece to help neighbour Bulgaria after Russia cuts gas supply
101.article_body: Greece will help Bulgaria deal with the new situation caused by the Russian decision to halt gas supplies to the country, Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis told his Bulgarian counterpart Kiril Petkov during a phone call. Petkov said that Mitsotakis has assured him that a long-delayed gas link between the two neighbours, the Interconnector Greece-Bulgaria (IGB), will be ready by June.

102.title: Give Karim Benzema the Ballon d'Or: Ex-Real Madrid player Mesut Özil
102.article_body: Reacting to Real Madrid forward Karim Benzema's brace in the first leg of Real Madrid's Champions League semi-final against Manchester City, ex-Real Madrid player Mesut Özil tweeted, "Give...Benzema the Ballon d'Or." Manchester City defeated Real Madrid 4-3 in the first leg with Kevin De Bruyne, Gabriel Jesus, Phil Foden and Bernardo Silva scoring for City.

103.title: BJP never promotes riots but stops them: Madhya Pradesh Minister
103.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Cabinet Minister and BJP leader Vishvas Kailash Sarang has said that "BJP never promotes riots but stops them". This comes after Congress' Digvijaya Singh alleged that BJP is paying poor Muslim youth to pelt stones, adding, "These aren't facts...I'm not accusing anyone." Reacting to Singh's statement, Sarang asked, "How could you level such charges when you...don't have proof."

104.title: I'm bravest actor, what have I left that someone else could do: Ayushmann
104.article_body: When asked about who he thinks is the bravest actor, Ayushmann Khurrana named himself and said he thinks he's the bravest of all. "Whom should I name who can be called braver than me...what have I left that...someone else could have done or thought of doing? But I envy certain characters like Ranbir Kapoor in Rockstar and Barfi," he added.

105.title: Focus should be on stopping fighting: Jaishankar on Ukraine war
105.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the best way to deal with the Ukraine conflict would be to focus on "stopping the fighting and getting the talking" to move forward. He added that India's position on the crisis is best placed to advance such an approach. India has not yet publicly condemned Russia's invasion and has called for dialogue-based resolution.

106.title: I always say that: Salah on whether he is the world's best player
106.article_body: Talking about whether he believes he is the best player in the world, Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah said, "In my mind, yes, I am always saying that...I don't choose anyone other than me." Salah is currently the highest goal-scorer in the ongoing 2021/22 season of the Premier League, having scored 22 goals so far. He has recorded 13 assists.

107.title: BJP targeting the NCP, misusing ED and CBI: Supriya Sule
107.article_body: NCP MP Supriya Sule accused the BJP of targeting the NCP and misusing Central agencies such as ED and CBI against its political opponents. "How is raking up issues like loudspeakers at places of worship going to benefit Maharashtra?" she questioned the BJP. Polarisation through communal unrest would only impact the country's economic growth and development, she added.

108.title: Political asylum only for homeless, I have home in Cong: KV Thomas
108.article_body: Congress leader KV Thomas on Wednesday rejected CPI(M) Kerala secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan's invitation to join the party, stating that he has a home in Congress, adding that political asylum is for the homeless. "Party positions are like tables and chairs. If that is taken away and I am given a stool, I have no problem with that," he said.

109.title: Man tries to sacrifice daughter for treasure in Maha; 9 arrested
109.article_body: Police have arrested nine persons for allegedly trying to sacrifice an 18-year-old in order to find hidden treasure in Maharashtra's Yavatmal. The victim's father had started performing tantrik rituals over the last few days and had dug a pit to bury his daughter, an official said. The victim somehow managed to inform her friend who subsequently informed the police.

110.title: K'taka Home Minister protecting PSI scam accused: DK Shivakumar
110.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Wednesday alleged that state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra is protecting the main accused in the Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "Government should give a notice to Jnanendra...for providing protection to Divya Hagaragi (prime accused)," he said. CM Basavaraj Bommai had earlier said that everything related to the PSI scam would be probed.

111.title: 'Mohammadpur is Madhavpuram now': Delhi BJP chief puts up board
111.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Wednesday said that the name of south Delhi's Mohammadpur village has been changed to Madhavpuram. He said that since the Aam Aadmi Party-led government did not act on the proposal submitted by the South Delhi Municipal Corporation in December, the party members have renamed the place on their own.

112.title: China opposes US warship’s passage through Taiwan Strait
112.article_body: The People's Liberation Army (PLA) of China on Wednesday released a statement opposing the passage of a US warship - USS Sampson guided-missile destroyer - through the Taiwan Strait. "The US has been frequently carrying out provocative acts to send wrong signals to 'Taiwan Independence' forces, deliberately undermining peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait," said the statement.

113.title: Sadhguru is on global tour, he didn't meet Will Smith: Sadhguru's team
113.article_body: After several reports claimed that Hollywood star Will Smith was recently in India to meet Sadhguru after the Chris Rock slap controversy, Sadhguru's media relations team confirmed that the news isn't true. They said, "Sadhguru is on a global tour to promote Save Soil Movement. Sadhguru has not met Will Smith recently."

114.title: There’s probably a lot of people praying for my downfall: Naomi Osaka
114.article_body: Ex-world number one Naomi Osaka tweeted that probably there are a lot of people "praying [for her] downfall", but she doesn't feel it as the love overpowers everything. Osaka is a four-time Grand Slam champion. She is the first Japanese tennis player to win Australian Open having won the tournament in 2019. Osaka has played in four tournaments in 2022.

115.title: Instagram tests feature to let users pin posts to their profile
115.article_body: Instagram is testing a new feature to let users pin specific posts to their profile above their photo grid. Users who have access to the feature in the test phase are seeing a 'Pin to your profile' option that can be selected from the three-dot menu next to posts. Currently, users have the option to pin Stories to their profiles.

116.title: Chandigarh to seek French experts' help to protect 12,000 heritage items
116.article_body: The Chandigarh Administration has decided to ask for help from French experts in preserving and protecting its 12,000 heritage items. Reports said that the heritage items may be sold abroad for lakhs. "We will seek their help and have detailed discussion on the issue...we will ask them to help us technologically to protect the items," UT Adviser Dharam Pal said.

117.title: Power company engineer held for taking bribe in Madhya Pradesh
117.article_body: A junior engineer of a government-owned power company was caught red-handed while taking bribe to settle an electricity-related case in Madhya Pradesh on Wednesday. The accused, identified as Virendra Singh Chouhan, was posted in Narsinghpur. According to an EOW official, Chouhan had allegedly demanded ₹15,000 to settle a case related to seizure of electric wires from the complainant's farm.

118.title: Syria's humanitarian situation remains dire amid economic crisis: UN
118.article_body: The UN deputy emergency relief coordinator, Joyce Msuya, on Tuesday said humanitarian situation in Syria remains dire amid a worsening economic crisis in the country. Msuya said, "As the eyes of the world turn to other conflicts, Syria is on the verge of becoming yet another forgotten crisis despite millions of Syrians struggling each month to survive."

119.title: Denmark arrests man for promoting Islamic State on social media
119.article_body:
A man was arrested on Wednesday in Denmark on suspicion of violating the country's anti-terrorism laws by allegedly promoting the Islamic State group on social media. Police gave no other details except 
that the domestic security agency PET was involved in the operation. Last month, PET had said that Denmark's "biggest terrorist threat" remains people who sympathise with Islamic militants.

120.title: Man rapes cow in UP, arrested after neighbour finds CCTV footage
120.article_body: A man in Lucknow has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a cow. The complainant alleged that the man was seen having sex with the cow on Saturday in CCTV footage. The neighbour then informed the owner of the cow after which a search party was formed by the locals to apprehend the accused.

121.title: 17-year-old Pune girl found 3-month pregnant, rape case filed against husband, father
121.article_body: Pune Police filed a case of rape and invoked anti-child marriage legislation after receiving report from a government hospital of a 17-year-old girl being three months pregnant. Police have booked the girl's 19-year-old husband and father. Police said that they have provided counsellor support to the girl and were in contact with both families to sensitively deal with the situation.

122.title: Only mom & I live in my mansion, I wander in the house at night: Nawazuddin
122.article_body: In a new video posted by RJ Siddharth Kannan, he gave a quick tour of Nawazuddin Siddiqui's Mumbai mansion. The video also included audio clips of their conversation about the actor's home. In the clip, Nawazuddin is heard saying, "Only my mother and I live in this house. At night, when I'm unable to sleep...I wander around like a ghost."

123.title: I will choose Cristiano Ronaldo over Lionel Messi in my team: Kaka
123.article_body: Ex-Real Madrid footballer Kaka said he will choose Cristiano Ronaldo over Lionel Messi in his team, adding that the chances of Ronaldo's failure are very less as he is very determined and focused. "Messi is a genius and Ronaldo has a very strong mentality," stated Kaka. Ronaldo currently represents Manchester United having earlier played for Real Madrid and Juventus.

124.title: Stopped from thrashing wife, UP man sets mom ablaze; consumes poison
124.article_body: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi allegedly set his 60-year-old mother on fire after she stopped him from thrashing his wife. The accused, Mahajan, later consumed poison himself. While his mother died, Mahajan is struggling for life. Reports said Mahajan used to pressure his mother to empty her room as he wanted to stay there with his wife and children.

125.title: Why do you dub your movies in Hindi if it's not our national language: Ajay to Sudeep
125.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has reacted to Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep's remark that Hindi is "no more" a national language. Ajay tweeted, "According to you, if Hindi is not our national language then why do you release your mother tongue movies by dubbing them in Hindi?" Ajay added, "Hindi was, is and always will be our mother tongue and national language."

126.title: 'Hobbit' human ancestors may be hiding on Indonesian island: Anthropologist
126.article_body: An anthropologist retired from the University of Alberta has claimed that "Hobbit" human ancestors or Homo floresiensis may still be hiding on an Indonesian island. Studies over the years concluded that they went extinct some 12,000 years ago. Gregory Forth's book includes sighting reports from over 30 eyewitnesses, with whom he spoke directly.

127.title: ‘Heropanti 2’ is not muddy and dirty, every frame is slick: Tiger Shroff
127.article_body: Talking about his upcoming film ‘Heropanti 2’, actor Tiger Shroff said, “‘Heropanti 2’ is not muddy and dirty, every frame is slick.” “It has the vibe of say ‘Mission Impossible’ meets ‘James Bond’ meets ‘War’,” added Tiger. Discussing movies from the ‘Baaghi’ franchise in which he stars as well, Tiger stated that ‘Baaghi’ was raw and rustic.

128.title: India's alternative fuels sector to create 50-60 lakh jobs: Gadkari
128.article_body: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said the alternative fuels sector will create 50-60 lakh jobs in India. He added that green hydrogen is the way forward and in the future, India will lead the world in this space. "My request to all manufacturers is that we need green hydrogen, because the government has a commitment for the environment," he stated.

129.title: Pak PM’s pre-arrest bail extended in money laundering case
129.article_body: A Pakistani court on Wednesday extended the pre-arrest bail granted to PM Shehbaz Sharif and his son Hamza Shehbaz, who is Punjab CM-elect, in a PKR 14 billion (₹574 crore) money laundering case. The PM was also granted exemption from appearing in person before the court. Sharif and his two sons were booked by Pakistan's Federal Investigation Agency in 2020.

130.title: UN chief Antonio Guterres condemns Karachi blast that killed 4
130.article_body: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Tuesday condemned the attack that occurred inside the premises of the University of Karachi in Pakistan and expressed his condolences, said his Deputy spokesman, Farhan Haq. Three Chinese nationals were among the four persons who were killed in the blast. The blast reportedly occurred in a van near the gate of the Confucius Institute.

131.title: Nepal bans import of 10 items, including cars, amid forex crisis
131.article_body: Nepal has banned import of 10 luxurious items, including cars and diamonds, amid its depleting foreign exchange reserves. The ban, which will be in place until end of this fiscal year in mid-July, will include other items such as liquor, cigarette and tobacco products and motorcycles. Earlier this month, Nepal urged citizens living abroad to deposit funds in domestic banks.

132.title: Climate change risking 10-18% of South Asia's GDP: Study
132.article_body: Climate change could see 10-18% of GDP of South Asian countries like India, Bangladesh and Pakistan lost by 2050, a study by ratings firm S&P Global revealed. This is 10 times the risk to Europe and three times the risk to North America. Overall, climate change could put 4% of global GDP at risk by 2050, the report stated.

133.title: Would've liked Will Smith but not now: Henry on which actor should play him
133.article_body: Ex-Arsenal forward Thierry Henry said he would have earlier liked to name Will Smith as the actor who should portray him in a film, but will not do so now. "I would go [with] Chris Tucker," added Henry. Smith recently resigned from the Oscars Academy after slapping Chris Rock at Oscars, for making a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett.

134.title: I'm part of Salman Khan's 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali': Aayush Sharma
134.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma has confirmed that he will be joining Salman Khan in the film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', which will be directed by Farhad Samji. "Yes, I am a part of the film and I'm looking forward to experimenting with my cinematic aptitude with this project," Aayush stated. The duo previously shared screen space in 'Antim: The Final Truth'.

135.title: 3 men, including boyfriend, rape minor girl in Nagpur; arrested
135.article_body: A minor girl was allegedly gang-raped by her boyfriend and two of his friends in Nagpur, following which the three were arrested. On April 17, the accused shared intimate videos he had recorded without the girl's permission with his friends and used them to ask for sexual favours for the two. The group then allegedly gang-raped the minor, reports said.

136.title: Justin Lin steps down as 'Fast X' director after 10 yrs with franchise
136.article_body: Justin Lin has stepped down as the director of 'Fast X' after being associated with the franchise for 10 years. In a statement released by the franchise's official Twitter handle, Justin said, "I've made the difficult decision to step back as director of 'Fast X'." "Over 10 years...five films, we've been able to shoot the best actors...stunts...car chases," he added.

137.title: Reduce central excise first: Cong on PM's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel
137.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to CMs of Maharashtra, West Bengal, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Jharkhand and Tamil Nadu to reduce VAT on petrol and diesel, Congress said that he should first reduce central excise. "(Centre) earned ₹26 lakh crore out of central excise...(and) didn't give the GST share to the states on time," Congress' Pawan Khera said.

138.title: Man, wife stabbed to death in UP's Muzaffarnagar over old rivalry
138.article_body: A 50-year-old man and his 48-year-old wife were allegedly stabbed to death by three people in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar over an old rivalry, police said on Wednesday. The accused pulled the victims out of an e-rickshaw and killed them, police added. The husband and his two sons were arrested in a murder case in June 2021, police stated.

139.title: EU accuses Russia of blackmail as it cuts gas to Poland & Bulgaria
139.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said that Russia's decision to stop delivering gas to Bulgaria and Poland is "an instrument of blackmail". The move is "unjustified and unacceptable" and shows the unreliability of Russia as a gas supplier, she added. The EU is working on a coordinated response to the escalation by Moscow, she further said.

140.title: 5 killed, 1 injured as SUV falls into canal in Punjab's Ludhiana
140.article_body: As many as five persons were killed and one was injured as the SUV they were travelling in fell into the Sidhwan canal in Punjab's Ludhiana, police said. The SUV's doors got locked inside the water and by the time the victims were taken out from the canal, they were all dead, except one, police added.

141.title: Warner Bros officially announces 'The Batman 2' at the CinemaCon 2022
141.article_body: Hollywood studio Warner Bros has officially announced a sequel to Robert Pattinson-starrer 'The Batman' during a presentation at the CinemaCon 2022 on Tuesday. "Matt Reeves (director), Robert and the entire team will be taking audiences back to Gotham with 'The Batman 2'," Warner Bros Pictures Group chief Toby Emmerich said. The 2022 film also featured Zoe Kravitz and Colin Farrell.

142.title: Musk's ideas would be great for Twitter: Largest ad group WPP CEO
142.article_body: World's largest advertising group WPP CEO Mark Read in an interview with Bloomberg Television discussed Elon Musk's Twitter deal, saying, "Many of his ideas around fake bots, and improving the algorithms...would be great for the platform, great for users and great for our clients," Read said. He added he doesn't expect any potential crackdown on advertising on Twitter in future.

143.title: Copied some moves from Abhishek's dancing as a kid: Big B on 'Khaike Paan...'
143.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said on Instagram that some of his dance steps in the song 'Khaike Paan Banaraswala' from his film 'Don', were "copied" from son Abhishek Bachchan's sideways movement as a kid. "Haha, still moving sideways," read the reaction from Abhishek to the post shared by Amitabh, which featured a clip of him dancing to the song.

144.title: LIC to reserve 10% of IPO size for policyholders
144.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) on Wednesday announced that it will be reserving 10% of its IPO size, or 2.21 crore shares, for policyholders. Additionally, policyholders will be offered a discount of ₹60/share while employees and retail investors will be offered a discount of ₹45/share. The maximum bid amount under the Policyholder Reservation Portion must not exceed ₹2 lakh.

145.title: Kerala University distributes answer key instead of paper, Guv seeks report
145.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan has sought a report after the answer key was distributed instead of question paper to students in an exam at Kerala University. The Governor has also sought a report after exams were postponed at Kannur University when it was found that the previous year's question papers have been repeated once again this year.

146.title: BJP, VHP hold protest march in Raj against Alwar temple demolition
146.article_body: BJP, VHP and other Hindu organisations on Wednesday held a protest march in Rajasthan against the demolition of a 300-year-old Shiva temple in Alwar. BJP MP Balaknath said, "We've demanded...action against involved officers, construction of the demolished temple and resignation of Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot." Notably, the state government has suspended three officials over the temple's demolition.

147.title: 500+ left homeless as fire at Manesar scrapyard destroys 100+ shanties
147.article_body: After a massive fire broke out in a scrapyard in sector 6 of IMT Manesar on Monday night, over 100 hutments were destroyed, leaving over 500 people homeless. A 48-year-old woman was also killed in the incident. A resident of the area said that she and her family had to leave everything, including ₹1.5 lakh case they had saved, behind.

148.title: Masks made mandatory in Kerala amid COVID surge, violation punishable
148.article_body: Amid rise in COVID-19 cases, the Kerala government on Wednesday made wearing of masks mandatory. In its latest order, the government has said that any violation to the rule will be punishable. State Health Minister Veena George had earlier said that the government would  "continue to remain vigilant since other states are reporting an increase in the number of cases".

149.title: Deepika Padukone to be part of Cannes Film Festival 2022 jury
149.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone will be a part of the main jury at the Cannes Film Festival this year. The jury for the festival's 75th edition will be presided over by French actor Vincent Lindon. Lindon, along with the jury members, will reward one of the 21 films in competition with the Palme d'or, on May 28, during the closing ceremony.

150.title: Which overseas players have recorded most ducks in IPL?
150.article_body: With his golden duck against RR, Glenn Maxwell recorded his 12th duck in the history of IPL. It is the most number of ducks by an overseas cricketer. He overtook Rashid Khan, who has 11 IPL ducks to his name. Sunil Narine and AB de Villiers have been dismissed on a duck 10 times each.

151.title: Michael Slater avoids jail in domestic violence case, sent to mental health hospital
151.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Michael Slater avoided jail on Wednesday after a court in Sydney dismissed domestic violence charges against him on mental health grounds. The court has ordered Slater to spend three weeks in a mental health hospital. Slater has been arrested multiple times for domestic violence against his ex-girlfriend.

152.title: I think I broke 3-4 remote controls: Ricky Ponting on RR-DC match
152.article_body: Referring to RR-DC match which he missed due to quarantine, DC head coach Ricky Ponting said, "It was frustrating. I think I broke three or four remote controls." He added, "When you're on sidelines...being a coach...and you can't control what's happening out in the middle...that's hard enough...but when you're not actually at ground...it can get a little more frustrating."

153.title: NCPCR seeks report as B'luru school allegedly asks kids to carry Bible
153.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has sought a report from the district administration after a Bengaluru school allegedly asked children to carry Bibles. Right-wing group Hindu Janajagruti Samiti had alleged the school took an undertaking from parents to allow students to carry Bibles. The group's members also met Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh over the matter.

154.title: They will feel 'really hurt': Daniel Vettori on RCB's 29-run loss vs RR
154.article_body: Discussing RCB's defeat by 29 runs against RR having been handed a target of 145, ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori said the RCB players will feel "really hurt" by the performance of their batters. "RCB's bowling unit...[was] fantastic and disciplined," added Vettori. RCB were bowled out for 115 with captain Faf Du Plessis their highest run-getter, having scored 23 runs.

155.title: Kohli has experienced these highs and lows before too: Bangar
155.article_body: RCB head coach Sanjay Bangar has said Virat Kohli has experienced "highs and lows many times before" and he'll soon emerge from "this run of low scores". Bangar added, "Kohli is so mentally strong, he'll be able to put in better performance [in upcoming games]." Kohli has scored 128 runs in nine games so far this season.

156.title: I'll go if I lose majority in Parliament: SL PM amid resignation calls
156.article_body: Sri Lanka PM Mahinda Rajapaksa has said that he will only step down if he loses the majority in the Parliament. Anti-government protesters in Sri Lanka are demanding the PM and his younger brother President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's resignation over the island nation's worsening economic crisis. The crisis has led to a shortage of essential items in the country.

157.title: PM Narendra Modi inaugurates children's heart hospital in Fiji
157.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated the Sri Sathya Sai Sanjeevani Children's Heart Hospital in Fiji via video conferencing. "I express my gratitude to the Prime Minister of Fiji and the people of Fiji for this," he added. "This is a symbol of our traditional relationship and another chapter in the shared journey of India-Fiji," PM Modi further said.

158.title: Thieves in business attire fly from Delhi to Kochi to rob big houses; arrested
158.article_body: The police have arrested a trio of thieves who landed in Kerala's Kochi from Delhi in business attire to rob big houses. They allegedly carried out thefts in four houses on consecutive days from April 21, reports say. Approximately 160 gm of gold ornaments amounting to ₹8 lakh, ₹70,000 cash, $411 and wristwatches including a Rolex were recovered from them.

159.title: It worries me a lot more than the 68 all out: Bishop on RCB's loss vs RR
159.article_body: Reacting to RCB's loss by 29 runs against RR, ex-West Indies pacer Ian Bishop said the defeat worries him a "lot more" than the team being bowled out for 68 runs, in their previous match against SRH. "I am still not seeing Virat Kohli getting the runs that he needs to get for this team to prosper," added Bishop.

160.title: Delhi school near Bhalswa landfill shut due to toxic smoke after fire
160.article_body: Delhi's Gyan Sarovar School has been temporarily closed after a massive fire broke out at Bhalswa landfill site on Tuesday. "It's not safe to keep children here because of the smoke...We've decided to keep the school closed for a week," a community organiser said. Locals living near the area complained of breathing and visibility issues, as per ANI report.

161.title: PM Modi asks states to audit hospitals to prevent fire incidents
161.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday asked all states to ensure safety audits of hospitals on a priority basis. "I urge all states to get safety audits of all hospitals done on a priority basis to prevent fire incidents which have been increasing amid heatwave. Our response time should also be minimal," he said during a COVID-19 review meeting with CMs.

162.title: When rules-based order was challenged in Asia, Europe advised us to do more trade: EAM
162.article_body: Defending India's stand on Russia-Ukraine conflict, EAM S Jaishankar told European leaders, "When the rules-based order was under challenge in Asia, the advice we got from Europe was do more trade. At least we're not giving you that advice." He added, "In terms of Afghanistan, please show me which part of the rules-based order justified what the world did there."

163.title: We shot at a place where shooting was termed impossible: 'Thar' director Raj
163.article_body: Sharing his experience while shooting his film 'Thar', director Raj Singh Chaudhary said, "It was a tough shoot in terms of terrain...One such location was...an 800-year-old structure." "The production [team] told me...it was impossible to shoot there [as it's in the middle of nowhere on top of the mountain]. I convinced them and the production [team]...created a road," added Raj.

164.title: Do well: Sushmita to fan who stalks her profile for motivation amid exam stress
164.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen replied to a fan who stalked her on Instagram to get motivation amid exam stress. The user commented on her post stating, "My ICSE exams have started and I'm feeling...tensed right now. I'm...stalking your profile and reading the captions for some motivation." To which, Sushmita replied, "All the best jaan meri...study and do your best! You'll do...well."

165.title: 5 Pune mosques say no to DJ music during Eid amid loudspeaker row
165.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy over usage of loudspeakers at religious places, authorities of five mosques in Pune have decided to shun DJ music during Eid al-Fitr celebration on May 2. The authorities also appealed to the community to avoid playing loud music during festival, adding that funds collected to procure the DJ systems should be used to aid needy people.

166.title: Delhi temperature likely to cross 44°C tomorrow, yellow alert issued
166.article_body: The temperature in Delhi is expected to cross the 42-degree mark today and 44-degree mark on Thursday. The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert warning of a heatwave spell in the national capital, starting April 28. PTI also quoted an official as saying that the maximum temperature may leap to 46 degree Celsius in parts of Delhi.

167.title: I became over-sensitive: Eijaz Khan on challenges faced while growing up
167.article_body: Discussing the impact of challenges faced while growing up, actor Eijaz Khan said, "I became over-sensitive and...started working from a space of a victim." "I try to see that my childhood trauma or whatever traumas we face in our formative years, if it has put speed breakers...in my growth and relationships now, then I go for therapy," added Eijaz.

168.title: Delhi govt to develop over 2000 classrooms as 'hi-tech digital'
168.article_body: The Delhi government has announced its plan to develop over 2000 classrooms as 'hi-tech digital' facilities for students of classes 6 to 12 of government schools. About 2,211 classrooms will be developed as digital classrooms, with 75 inches or bigger interactive flat display panels, UHD resolution and touch screen. The estimated cost of the project is ₹65.43 crore, reports said.

169.title: New Delhi Railway Station's revamp to decongest CP: RLDA VC
169.article_body: New Delhi Railway Station's redevelopment will help in decongesting Connaught Place and is expected to generate revenue of ₹10,000-12,000 crore, Rail Land Development Authority (RLDA) VC VP Dudeja said. Under the project, a 40-storey commercial twin-tower will be built. Two multi-modal transport hubs, one on Ajmeri Gate side and another on Paharganj side, will also be developed, Dudeja added.

170.title: We cannot please other nations by being 'pale imitation' of what they are: India
170.article_body: Amid pressure from the West to take a strong stand on Russia's Ukraine invasion, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "I think it's better to engage with the world on the basis of who we are." He further said that India cannot please other nations by "being a pale imitation of what they are".

171.title: Country needs alternative agenda, not political regrouping: T'gana CM
171.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday said the country needs alternative agenda and not political fronts or political realignment. While addressing members on 21st foundation day of Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS), Rao said that he had turned down the idea of communist leaders to 'dislodge' the BJP, adding, the focus should not be on bringing down any party.

172.title: Mira Kapoor invests in organic grocery startup ﻿Zama Organics
172.article_body: Mira Kapoor has invested an undisclosed amount in organic and healthy grocery startup Zama Organics. Founded by Shriya Naheta Wadhwa, Zama Organics focuses on building a farm-to-table supply chain for organic and natural vegetables, fruits and groceries. It is backed by angel investors like BillDesk Director and Co-Founder Ajay Kaushal and Guardian Advisors Director Arjun Lamba, among others.

173.title: Something bad happens in Bollywood, then entire industry is b**ch: Ajay Devgn
173.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said that the entire industry is called b**ch if something bad happens [in Bollywood] like if "X person says something". "And maybe that person is not part of industry, he may be a so-called actor or struggler but the HL says Actor XYZ did," he said, adding, "People are like...why are...celebs quiet...because there is reaction to everything."

174.title: Speeding garbage truck hits bike in Mumbai, 16-year-old killed
