174.article_body: A 16-year-old girl who was riding pillion on a bike with her 23-year-old friend died after a speeding garbage truck hit their two-wheeler on Mumbai's Western Express highway in Malad (East). The duo were on their way home when the truck hit them and the girl went under the wheels of the heavy vehicle, the police said.

175.title: Pune farmer hires helicopter to bring home newborn granddaughter
175.article_body: A farmer from Pune's Balewadi hired a helicopter to bring his newborn granddaughter and daughter-in-law home on Tuesday. The man, Ajit Pandurang Balwadkar, told reporters that he wanted to accord a special welcome to his granddaughter Krushika, who was residing at her maternal grandparents' house in Shewal Wadi. Balwadkar then sent a helicopter there to pick them up.

176.title: Mumtaz gets discharged from hospital, says 'I'm weak but I have recovered'
176.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz, who was admitted to hospital because of a severe stomach infection, has been discharged now. Speaking about it, Mumtaz said, "It was a very bad infection and I had to be hospitalised. I was there for a...week and now I'm back home, weak but fully recovered." "We need much better healthcare for the underprivileged," she added.

177.title: SDMC to start anti-encroachment drive in Delhi’s Jaitpur: Mayor
177.article_body: South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) Mayor Mukesh Suryan on Wednesday said that an anti-encroachment drive will soon be conducted in Delhi's Jaitpur. A team of SDMC officials reached the area for inspection before starting the drive. "There have been several complaints of illegal encroachment here…Some of them have been identified," said Suryan.

178.title: Man arrested for stalking PhD scholar on IISc campus in Bengaluru
178.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested at the Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru, for stalking a 27-year-old PhD scholar. According to the woman, the man was her former university mate and was deliberate to have a relationship with her, which she rejected. The man also allegedly posted the woman's pictures on his Facebook account, stating that she was his wife.

179.title: We're ticking all boxes to win matches, but lacking in execution: Shreyas Iyer
179.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer has said they're ticking all boxes to win matches in the ongoing IPL season but are lacking in the "execution part". He added, "It's just a matter of time once we get going, we'll be unstoppable as a team." He further said, "The qualifiers are at the Eden Gardens...we'll put in our 100 per cent."

180.title: Bihar groom among 3 injured after he opens fire at wedding event
180.article_body: An 18-year-old groom in Bihar’s Ara was among three persons injured when he and his friends fired shots in the air from a country-made revolver at a wedding event on Tuesday, police said. Bhojpur SP, Vinay Tiwary, said the groom and his friends will be arrested. The injured persons include the groom’s 12-year-old nephew and another relative.

181.title: LIC to reserve 10% of IPO offer for policyholders, 5% for employees
181.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) will be reserving 10% of the IPO offer size, or 2.21 crore shares, for policyholders with one or more policies as on date of IPO prospectus submission. Employees, however, will have 5% of the post-offer equity share capital, or 15.81 lakh shares, reserved. For both policyholders and employees, the maximum bidding amount cannot exceed ₹2 lakh.

182.title: She sent texts saying she had depression, I have screenshots: Vijay on rape charges
182.article_body: Malayalam actor Vijay Babu, who has been booked for allegedly raping a woman, claimed innocence and said he's the real victim. "She sent several messages to me saying...she was suffering from depression. I have around 400 screenshots...I haven't sent...messages to that woman for the last one-and-a-half years," he said. Vijay Babu further said he'll file a defamation case against her.

183.title: What are the highlights of LIC's IPO announcement made today?
183.article_body: Shares in LIC IPO will be sold for ₹902-949 with a ₹60 discount for policyholders and ₹45 discount for retail investors and employees, from May 4-9. LIC's IPO will be India's largest, with the government diluting its 3.5% stake for ₹20,557 crore. 10% of offer size is reserved for policyholders and 0.7% for employees. Anchor quota opens on May 2.

184.title: Russia's decision to cut off gas will make it more isolated: UK
184.article_body: After Russia's Gazprom confirmed it was cutting off gas deliveries to Poland and Bulgaria, UK Deputy PM Dominic Raab said the move would've a "very damaging effect" on Russia itself. Moscow is becoming "more and more, not just...political pariah, but an economic pariah", Raab added. Gazprom halted gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria after they refused to pay in roubles.

185.title: COVID-19 cases rising in some states, need to be alert: PM Modi to CMs
185.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday told the Chief Ministers of several states that the "COVID challenge has yet not been surpassed." "We are seeing an uptick in COVID cases in some states now, we need to stay alert," PM Modi said. "Administering vaccines to every eligible child at the earliest should be our priority," PM Modi told the Chief Ministers.

186.title: Reliance Industries becomes 1st Indian company to hit ₹19 lakh crore m-cap
186.article_body: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries (RIL) on Wednesday became the first Indian company to cross ₹19 lakh crore in market capitalisation. The company's stock jumped to a record high of ₹2,827.10 during intra-day trade on Wednesday. However, the ₹19 lakh crore market capitalisation milestone was briefly held by the company as the shares slid and were last trading at ₹2,781.65.

187.title: Never saw Kohli travel in business class as captain: Ex-cricketer Vivek Razdan
187.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, former cricketer Vivek Razdan said that he never saw Kohli travel in business class when he was the captain despite one seat on the flight being reserved for the captain. Razdan added, "Kohli always preferred to be with his teammates in economy class...There was always a bowler occupying [his] business class seat."

188.title: PM Modi urges several states to cut VAT on petrol and diesel
188.article_body: PM Narendra Modi urged several states to cut VAT on petrol and diesel in spirit of cooperative federalism. PM Modi stated states like Maharashtra, West Bengal, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Kerala and Jharkhand didn't cut VAT on petrol and diesel in November 2021 when Centre had cut tax on fuel prices. He added that it had affected the citizens.

189.title: 28-yr-old gangster carrying highest reward by Delhi Police arrested
189.article_body: A 28-year-old gangster, identified as Shahrukh who was carrying the highest reward by the Delhi Police of ₹2 lakh, was arrested along with his three associates from Chhatarpur on Monday. "They were found in possession of sophisticated firearms and live ammunition," police said. Shahrukh was involved in 10 criminal cases of murder, attempt to murder and extortion, among others.

190.title: Wrapped up in 2004, Ajay Devgn's 'Naam' to release after 18 years: Report
190.article_body: Ajay Devgn starrer 'Naam' that was reportedly wrapped up in 2004 is ready for a release this summer, reports said, adding that the makers are eyeing May-July for the release of the film. "Naam is truly special for me because it...marks fourth collaboration of Ajay and Anees post 'Deewangee', 'Pyaar To Hona Hi Tha' and 'Hulchul'," producer Anil Roongta said.

191.title: Umran has been improving ever since he started working with Steyn: Parthiv
191.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel has said SRH pacer Umran Malik has been improving under their bowling coach Dale Steyn. "It feels like Umran is setting up batters now. Earlier, he used to just bowl with raw pace. He is learning how to pick wickets under Steyn," added Parthiv. So far, Umran has picked 10 wickets in seven games.

192.title: This is dumb: Kim reacts to fans' claims that she photoshopped her poolside pics
192.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian reacted to accusations that said she photoshopped her poolside pictures. Taking to Instagram Stories, she wrote, "Come on guys...Seriously! This is so dumb! Claiming I photoshopped out my belly button?" In another Story, she wrote, "Belly button insecurities?! Why don't you head over to skims.com to conceal that saggy belly button of yours."

193.title: SpaceX launches its Crew 4 astronauts to International Space Station
193.article_body: SpaceX has successfully launched its Crew 4 mission astronauts to the International Space Station atop its Falcon 9 rocket. The crew consists of Kjell Lindgren, Robert Hines, Jessica Watkins, and Samantha Cristoforetti, who will spend six months aboard the ISS. With this mission, Watkins will become the first Black woman to serve aboard the space station.

194.title: 7 held following man's death after fight with bar staff in Noida mall
194.article_body: Seven people have been arrested in the case relating to the death of a man after a fight with the bar staff at a pub in Noida's Gardens Galleria mall. Those arrested include five staff members and two from the security team. The postmortem report had revealed that the victim died of a severe head injury and a fractured spleen.

195.title: Bengaluru RWAs oppose demand of restaurants, pubs being open 24/7
195.article_body: Resident Welfare Associations (RWAs) in Bengaluru are opposing the demand for allowing restaurants and pubs to stay open round the clock. People's night sleep is disturbed as "establishments have squeezed into even residential areas and operate till late hours with loud music", RWAs said. "You want to enjoy life 24x7? Go to 5-star hotel...Leave us in peace," RWAs activist said.

196.title: Auto driver arrested for sexually harassing 12-year-old girl in Pune
196.article_body: Police have arrested a 33-year-old auto driver for sexually harassing a 12-year-old girl and making obscene gestures after approaching her on the pretext of enquiring about an address on April 22 in Pune. The incident reportedly happened when the girl was returning from private tuition classes. The driver was arrested following an extensive manhunt after the girl's parents filed complaint.

197.title: 4 of family killed, 2 injured after bike hits bulldozer in Guj's Dahod
197.article_body: A labourer, his wife and their two minor sons were killed after their motorcycle hit a bulldozer which suddenly came in their way in Gujarat’s Dahod district on Tuesday evening, police said on Wednesday. Their two other children have suffered injuries. The bulldozer’s driver managed to escape after the accident, a police official said.

198.title: Ludhiana administration sets up donation corner for underprivileged kids
198.article_body: The Ludhiana district administration has set up a donation corner for underprivileged children outside the Deputy Commissioner’s office. The donation corner, which was inaugurated on Tuesday by Deputy Commissioner Surabhi Malik, comprises of a stationery ATM and a toys bank. The items donated by the public will be distributed among the needy.

199.title: Hands aren't moving, one was operated upon, other has IV: Chhavi after surgery
199.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal who recently had surgery after being diagnosed with breast cancer said that her hands are not moving. "One hand has been operated upon, one has IV, I am not moving them right now, but taking calls as much as I can," she said, adding that her family is worried but they feel better when she cracks jokes.

200.title: NASA's OSIRIS-REx spacecraft to visit a second asteroid
200.article_body: NASA's OSIRIS-REx spacecraft will get an extended mission to visit a second asteroid. NASA has extended the University of Arizona-led mission, which will be renamed OSIRIS-APEX, to study near-Earth asteroid Apophis for 18 months. The mission will make its first manoeuvre toward Apophis 30 days after the OSIRIS-REx spacecraft delivers the sample it collected from Bennu in October 2020.

201.title: At least 4 Syrian soldiers killed in Israeli airstrikes: Report
201.article_body: At least four Syrian soldiers were reportedly killed and a few others injured in airstrikes carried out by Israel. Several missiles struck near the Syrian capital, Damascus, in the pre-dawn hours of Wednesday, according to a Britain-based war monitor. The attacks came hours after Israel said that one of its drones had crashed on the Syrian side of the border.

202.title: So much pain, no amount of pain killer is helping: Actress Chhavi after cancer surgery
202.article_body: After undergoing breast cancer surgery, actress Chhavi Mittal said, "It's amazing how quickly we forget pain. The pain I felt after C section...or the excruciating pain of my back injury which also healed." "Right now there's so much pain that no amount of pain killer is helping. What's helping...is seeing the smiles on the faces of well wishers," she added.

203.title: Baby dies after slipping from nurse's hands in Lucknow, father told he was born dead
203.article_body: A newborn boy died after slipping from a nurse's hands at a private hospital in Lucknow. His father said, "I was told the baby was stillborn. However, when I spoke to my wife, she said she saw him alive." He added, "She saw a nurse taking the baby in her hands without any towel, when he slipped through her hand."

204.title: It's chauvinistic to ask if my husband is okay with me working: Actress Sana
204.article_body: Actress Sana Sayyad, who features in 'Spy Bahu', spoke about how questions about her husband's comfort with her profession reek of chauvinism. She said, "I don't like when people ask 'if your husband is comfortable with you working'." "That question is weird and is (chauvinistic). I'm not doing anything absurd for him to not like it," she added.

205.title: Samson wasting opportunities to press for India recall: Ian Bishop
205.article_body: Ex-WI fast bowler Ian Bishop has said RR captain Sanju Samson is "wasting good opportunities" due to his shot selection in the ongoing IPL season. Samson was playing on 27 against RCB when he attempted to play the standing reverse sweep on consecutive deliveries off Wanindu Hasaranga and got out. So far, Samson has scored 228 runs in eight games.

206.title: Man in Lucknow for a house-warming party molests minor girl in lift
206.article_body: A trader who had come to Lucknow for a house-warming party, allegedly molested a 12-year-old girl in the elevator of the apartment building. He reportedly ran away after the girl started screaming. The girl started crying when she reached home and told her mother about the incident, after which, her parents filed an FIR.

207.title: Musk usually does what he says he is going to do: Billionaire investor Novogratz
207.article_body: Billionaire investor Mike Novogratz has tweeted, "The hysteria around Elon Musk buying Twitter is unsettling. While his style might not be for everyone, he usually does what he says he is going to do." "Give him a chance to remove the bots. For that alone we will all be thanking him," Novogratz wrote.

208.title: Action should be taken if Twitter interferes with free speech in India: Tharoor
208.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said if Twitter is found either "interfering" with free speech in India or the opposite by permitting hate speech and abuse, then the IT committee should take action. "On Elon Musk: Who owns which social media company is not our concern. What matters is what they do and how," Tharoor tweeted.

209.title: Return ₹2.8 cr to mining firm for not honouring contract: HC to Punjab
209.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has directed the Punjab government to return about ₹2.8 crore to a mining firm for not honouring a 2017 contract. The firm had got the contract for Lubangarh but no mining work was done amid protests from locals. Notably, the contract was later cancelled and the amount deposited was forfeited.

210.title: 4 held with brown sugar worth ₹2 crore in West Bengal's Siliguri
210.article_body: The West Bengal police on Tuesday arrested four people with 1 kg of brown sugar worth ₹2 crore in Siliguri. Two of the arrested persons are from Nadia district while the other two are from Murshidabad. According to the police, the accused are members of an organised drug cartel involved in supplying drugs in North Bengal.

211.title: What is histrionic personality disorder that psychologist says actress Amber Heard has?
211.article_body: Histrionic personality disorder, that a psychologist said actress Amber Heard has, is also known as a dramatic personality disorder, as per US' National Library of Medicine. It is distinguished by a pattern of exaggerated attention-seeking behaviours. For people with histrionic personality disorder, their self-esteem depends on the approval of others, as per Cleveland Clinic.

212.title: Section 144 imposed to prevent 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' in U'khand's Dada Jalalpur
212.article_body: Haridwar District Magistrate Vinay Shankar Pandey has said that prohibitory orders under CrPC section 144 have been enforced in Dada Jalalpur village near Uttarakhand's Roorkee and in areas within its five-km radius where a 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' was scheduled to be held on Wednesday. "The gathering will not be allowed to be held at any cost," SSP Yogendra Singh Rawat said.

213.title: Ukraine demolishes monument depicting its friendship with Russia
213.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday demolished a monument in Kyiv which represented its historic ties with Russia. This comes amid the ongoing war between the two countries. "It took some effort but the Soviet sculpture of the two workers - symbolising the reunification of Ukraine and Russia - was dismantled," Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko was quoted as saying.

214.title: Product of 'parivarvad' can't be sold: BJP on Prashant Kishor not joining Cong
214.article_body: Reacting to the Congress' announcement that poll strategist Prashant Kishor has declined the offer to join the party, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that Congress' agenda is "parivar bachao (save the family)". "If the product is bad, no matter how good a salesman (might) be...you can't sell the product of parivarvad (dynasty politics) past its expiry date," he said.

215.title: Can't breathe, govt should take action: Locals near Bhalswa dump yard
215.article_body: Locals who live near Bhalswa dump yard, where a fire broke out on Tuesday, said that they are not able to breathe or see properly and that the government should take proper action on the situation of the dump yard, ANI reported. Reports also said that the dump yard was sending a dense plume of smoke into the sky.

216.title: Google-parent Alphabet's Q1 profit drops by over $1 billion
216.article_body: Google-parent Alphabet's net profit dropped to $16.4 billion in the first quarter compared to last year's $17.9 billion in the same quarter. Its revenue shot up 23% from the same period last year, reaching $68 billion. The company reported $54.66 billion in advertising revenue for the quarter, up from $44.68 billion the year prior.

217.title: 'Hate-in-India', Make-in-India can't coexist: Rahul Gandhi to PM Modi
217.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday tweeted about the exit of some global brands from India. "Modi ji, Hate-in-India and Make-in-India can't coexist!" he wrote on Twitter. The former Congress chief also shared a picture showing seven global brands, including Chevrolet, Harley Davidson, Man Trucks, Fiat, United Motors, Ford and Datsun, which have exited the country.

218.title: PM Modi to visit Germany, Denmark & France next week
218.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will be travelling to Germany, Denmark, and France between May 2-4, the Ministry of External Affairs said, adding, "This will be PM's first visit abroad in 2022." During his visit, he'll hold talks with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Denmark PM Mette Frederiksen, attend second India-Nordic Summit being hosted by Denmark, and meet French President Emmanuel Macron.

219.title: We're close to turning it all around: Ponting on DC losing 4 of their 7 games
219.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said they need to get momentum as they're close to turning it around in IPL 2022. "There's 36 or 37 overs of really good stuff...[but] we just let it slip for two or three overs...we've got to believe...And things will definitely change for us," he added. DC have lost 4 of their 7 games.

220.title: India's largest IPO of LIC to open on May 4, price band ₹902-949 per share
220.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO will open on May 4 and close on May 9, the company confirmed on Wednesday. The price band will be ₹902-949, with a ₹60 discount for policyholders and ₹45 discount for retail investors and employees. The IPO, through which the government is selling its 3.5% LIC stake to raise ₹20,557 crore, will be India's largest.

221.title: Air India proposes to acquire AirAsia India
221.article_body: Tata-owned Air India has proposed to acquire AirAsia India and has sought the deal's approval from the Competition Commission of India. AirAsia India is majority-owned by Tata Sons with a shareholding of 83.67% and the remaining stake is with AirAsia Investment Ltd (AAIL), part of Malaysia's AirAsia Group. Air India and Air India Express were acquired by Tata last year.

222.title: None of us should give advice to him, let the GOAT do his thing: RR's Riyan on idol Kohli
222.article_body: RR all-rounder Riyan Parag, who smashed a match-winning 56*(31) against RCB, reacted to ESPNcricinfo's tweet asking their followers about what advice they'd give to Virat Kohli amid his poor form. "None of us should, let the GOAT (Greatest of All Time) do his thing," Riyan wrote. The 20-year-old all-rounder considers Kohli as his idol.

223.title: MP Navneet Rana took loan of ₹80 lakh from builder Yusuf Lakdawala: Raut
223.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has alleged that Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana took a loan of ₹80 lakh from builder and film financier Yusuf Lakdawala, who died in jail in 2021. "Underworld connection of Rana has come up," he said. "Lakdawala was arrested by ED in a money laundering case of ₹200 crore...had links with 'D' gang," Raut added.

224.title: Action to continue against those trying to spread fake news: Anurag Thakur
224.article_body: A day after the government said it has blocked some YouTube news channels, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Tuesday said such actions will continue against those who spread misinformation and propaganda. "Those trying to spread this kind of propaganda, fake news, myths and fear, strict action will be taken in future, too. We cannot compromise on country’s security," Thakur added.

225.title: Who are the top 10 celebrity influencers on Instagram, as Alia ranked above JLo?
225.article_body: Alia Bhatt has been ranked 6th on the list of top 10 celebrity influencers on Instagram, as per a report by Influencer Marketing Hub. Jennifer Lopez, Chris Hemsworth and Robert Downey Jr have been ranked seventh, ninth and tenth, respectively. Zendaya has topped the list, followed by Tom Holland, The Rock, J-Hope and Will Smith.

226.title: Tomorrow if push comes to shove, pull out of the IPL: Shastri on Kohli's poor form
226.article_body: Referring to Virat Kohli's poor form, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "This year, he's already into IPL 2022, tomorrow if push comes to shove, pull out of...IPL...for all you care." Shastri added that a break would be ideal for Kohli for prolonging his international career. He further suggested players can even decide to play half of the tournament.

227.title: Mumbai woman fails to repay loan, recovery agent morphs her face on porn video
227.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested a 19-year-old loan recovery agent from Karnataka for sending a morphed porn video of a woman to her cousin after the victim failed to repay a loan. The victim's cousin got the video on WhatsApp along with a message that said the victim was now working as a sex worker as she failed to repay loan.

228.title: Don't switch off engines at every traffic signal: BMTC to drivers
228.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has instructed its midi bus drivers "not to switch off and restart the engine at every traffic signal to avoid an electrical shock circuit". The directive comes after an initial probe into three incidents of midi buses catching fire in the city this year revealed that the fires originated from the engine area.

229.title: K'taka Milk Federation asks K'taka govt to raise milk prices by ₹3/L
229.article_body: The Karnataka Milk Federation (KMF) has proposed to Karnataka government to raise the price of milk by ₹3/litre, citing 25%-30% rise in cost of raw materials and processing of milk. The KMF in its letter to CM Basavaraj Bommai said that other milk cooperatives in Karnataka have already raised milk prices but Nandini milk costs ₹8-10 less compared to them.

230.title: Man booked for sodomising 10-year-old nephew in Ludhiana
230.article_body: A 26-year-old man was booked for allegedly sodomising his 10-year-old nephew in Ludhiana’s Basant Nagar on Tuesday. The minor's parents had left him in the care of the accused man, the victim's mother said. "When we returned, my son said he was hurt and on being prodded he revealed that he had been sexually assaulted by the accused," she added.

231.title: There's Kapoor craze, wished our family to be like that in south: Chiranjeevi
231.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi said that there is a "Kapoor craze" in the Hindi cinema and that he wished for his family to be like that in south cinema. "I'm so happy to see how these kids (from Pawan Kalyan to Allu Arjun and others) have grown up and made a name for themselves in cinema," Chiranjeevi added.

232.title: France's Atos moves services delivered from Russia to India, Turkey
232.article_body: French IT consulting group Atos is moving its services currently delivered from Russia to other countries, including India and Turkey, amid the ongoing Ukraine-Russia war. Atos said the feasibility of the move has required significant planning in terms of implications for business operations and employees based in Russia. Atos stock lost half of its market value last year.

233.title: Reports of attack on CRPF in Shopian false, it was accident: Police
233.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian Police on Tuesday said that media reports claiming an attack on a CRPF party are false. The incident, in which 10 jawans were injured, was actually an accident, it added. It said that the driver lost control over the vehicle due to some technical fault and it skidded off the road and turned turtle.

234.title: TRS celebrates 21-year anniversary, KCR joins plenary meeting in Hyd
234.article_body: Telangana CM and Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) chief K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday joined the party's 21-year anniversary celebrations at the Hyderabad International Convention Centre. A plenary meeting of the TRS is being held, where 11 resolutions will be passed. "Two decades ago...Sri KCR Garu founded TRS to make aspirations of Telangana people a reality," Telangana minister KTR tweeted.

235.title: Every game had an individual who stood out: Tewatia on GT winning 6 of 7 games
235.article_body: Talking about their performance in the ongoing IPL season, GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said they're not dependent on one or two players to win games and "every game [so far] had an individual who stood out". He added, "This is a team game, team matters. We are happy that there's always someone who ends up [taking responsibility]."

236.title: Cong has to put its house in order with or without consultant: Digvijaya
236.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Wednesday said that ultimately the party has to move and put its house in order, with or without a consultant. His remark came a day after both poll strategist Prashant Kishor and the Congress announced that Kishor has declined the offer to join the party's Empowered Action Group.

237.title: Blood of the Chinese cannot be shed in vain: China as Pak blast kills 3 Chinese teachers
237.article_body: After the suicide attack at the Karachi University which killed three Chinese teachers and injured another, China said, "The blood of the Chinese cannot be shed in vain, and those behind this incident will surely pay the price." China asked Pakistan to scale-up security for its nationals working in the country and demanded a thorough investigation.

238.title: Woman accuses Malayalam actor Vijay Babu of raping her, says 'He recorded my nude video'
238.article_body: A woman has accused Malayalam actor-producer Vijay Babu of raping her multiple times during the past 1.5 months. She stated that Vijay used to intoxicate her and sexually abuse. She also alleged that he recorded a nude video of her, adding, "I fear for his blackmail and for my safety." Vijay has been booked by police.

239.title: Doesn't matter, it's about not having to label everything: Harry on sexuality
239.article_body: Singer Harry Styles said that he has been "really open" about his sexuality with his friends but that it is his personal experience. "The whole point of where we should be heading...which is towards accepting everybody and being more open...is that it doesn't matter...and it's about not having to label everything...not having to clarify what boxes you're checking," he added.

240.title: Fatima fell out of jeep while it was in motion; we got scared: Thar director
240.article_body: 'Thar' director Raj Singh Chaudhary said the cast have put their blood and sweat into the film. He added, "Satish (Kaushik) climbed mountains and Anil (Kapoor)...was riding a bike on terrains." "There was one shot where Fatima...fell out of the jeep while it was in motion and we all got scared but she...brushed herself...and got into the jeep," he said.

241.title: Provide better connectivity to Bharatpur: Raj CM writes to Nitin Gadkari
241.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday wrote a letter to Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, seeking better road connectivity to Bharatpur, which is known for a popular bird sanctuary. Gehlot demanded an extension of the road connecting Paniyala Mod and Delhi-Mumbai Expressway up to Bharatpur. He further asked the highways minister to declare the Alwar-Bharatpur road as a national highway.

242.title: Trump's Truth Social beating Twitter & TikTok: Musk on pic of Apple Store's top charts
242.article_body: Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, tweeted a screenshot of Apple Store's top charts. "Truth Social is currently beating Twitter & TikTok on...Apple Store," he wrote. Truth Social, an alt-tech social media platform, was founded by ex-US President Donald Trump in February. "That means you also buy Apple Store now and sort it out," a user jokingly wrote.

243.title: Watched how RCB bowled, kept it on good length: Kuldeep Sen on 4/20
243.article_body: RR pacer Kuldeep Sen, who picked four wickets against RCB, has revealed that he observed how Harshal Patel and Mohammed Siraj bowled and realised that the ball was stopping from a good length. "So, Sanju told me to hit the deck hard, the plan was to keep it on a good length," he added. RR won by 29 runs.

244.title: Robinhood fires 9% full-time employees, cites 'hyper growth'
244.article_body: Citing "hyper growth", Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev has said the trading platform is firing 9% full-time employees. "This rapid headcount growth has led to some duplicate roles...and more layers and complexity than are optimal," Tenev added. "After carefully considering these factors, we determined that making these reductions to staff is the right decision to improve efficiency," Tenev further said.

245.title: US offers $10 mn reward for information on Russian intelligence officers
245.article_body: The US is offering a reward of up to $10 million for information on six Russian intelligence officers who'd allegedly conducted cyber-attacks affecting key US infrastructure. The officers, working for Russian military intelligence agency GRU, were involved in a 2017 global malware attack that infected the computers of many private US entities, including a hospital system, US State Department said.

246.title: Mumbai's KEM hospital to start paid ward facility from today
246.article_body: The BMC's King Edward Memorial (KEM) hospital, for the first time, will start the facility of 17-bed paid ward on pilot basis from today. The private ward at KEM will have AC beds tentatively priced at ₹1,200 daily and non-AC beds for ₹900 daily, an official said. Until now, BMC-run hospitals provided subsidised treatment and did not charge for beds.

247.title: 12-year-old boy arrested for raping 5-year-old girl in Jharkhand: Police
247.article_body: A 12-year-old boy has been arrested for allegedly raping a five-year-old girl in Torpa Police Station area in Jharkhand's Khunti district, police said on Tuesday. The incident took place on Saturday when the girl went to buy cold drink from a shop near her house, police added. The boy, who was alone there, allegedly raped her, police further said.

248.title: Nothing out of syllabus: Raj minister on Cong-related questions in exam
248.article_body: A day after the Union Ministry of Education wrote to the Rajasthan government over six Congress-related questions in Class XII state Board examination, Education Minister BD Kalla said that nothing was out of syllabus. "The RBSE (Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education) is an autonomous body and there is no interference from the state government," Kalla added.

249.title: 3 in 4 kids have had coronavirus infections in the US: Study
249.article_body: US' CDC researchers have estimated that three out of every four US children have been infected with the coronavirus. They also found that more than half of all Americans had signs of previous infections. In the case of Americans of all ages, about 34% had signs of prior infection in December and two months later 58% did.

250.title: Dad didn't have a childhood; he was on footpaths of Mumbai: Jaaved on Jagdeep
250.article_body: Actor Jaaved Jaaferi said his father Jagdeep didn't have a childhood. He was the bread earner of his family from the age of nine. "After Partition, everything was wiped out. [Dad] was on...streets. He was on...footpaths of Mumbai with his mother. He had to start from scratch," Jaaved added. "He had to fend for himself and his mother," Jaaved said.

251.title: Dad sung song even if he didn't like it, had no other way to earn money: Aditya
251.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan said his father and singer Udit Narayan and his colleagues had to sing a song even if they didn't like it back in the day because there was no other way for them to earn money. "I'm earning my bread and butter from my career as host...So, I do not have to...compromise on my music," he added.

252.title: 2 men arrested for kidnapping 17-year-old girl in Mumbai
252.article_body: Two men have been arrested for kidnapping a 17-year-old girl in Mumbai, police said on Tuesday. The girl reportedly went missing on April 8 following which her mother filed a police complaint. According to police, the girl used her mother's mobile phone. "We...tracked down the most called number's location and found the girl in Juhu," a police officer said.

253.title: Delhi Metro begins constructing 5th bridge over river Yamuna
253.article_body: Delhi Metro has started work on a fifth bridge across river Yamuna under Phase-IV expansion of the Pink Line, officials said on Tuesday. The bridge, which is 560 metres long, will connect the Soorghat metro station with Sonia Vihar metro station on the corridor. "Pile foundation work is near completion...approximately 50% of sub-structure has been completed," a DMRC official said.

254.title: He will be hungry to perform: Piyush Chawla on Shubman Gill
254.article_body: Ahead of GT's match against SRH, cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said GT opener Shubman Gill will be hungry to perform after scoring a total of 27 runs in his last four games in IPL 2022. "Shubman did score runs in the initial matches but then hasn't been in great form," added Chawla. In GT's seven games, Shubman has scored 207 runs.

255.title: Saudi Arabia to buy 1 lakh EVs over 10 yrs: Luxury EV maker Lucid
255.article_body: Luxury EV maker Lucid has said that the government of Saudi Arabia has agreed to buy up to one lakh of its electric vehicles over the next ten years. Saudi Arabia's initial orders will be between 1,000 and 2,000 vehicles per year starting in 2023. It has committed to purchase 50,000 vehicles, with an option to buy an additional 50,000.

256.title: Ex-Myanmar leader Suu Kyi handed 5 year jail term for accepting $600,000 cash
256.article_body: A court in military-ruled Myanmar has sentenced ex-leader Aung San Suu Kyi to five years in jail after finding her guilty of corruption, Reuters reported quoting a source with knowledge of proceedings. The case centred on allegations that Suu Kyi accepted 11.4 kg of gold and cash payments totalling $600,000 from former Yangon chief minister Phyo Min Thein.

257.title: Did 17-18 films after 'Om..'; didn't have guidance, left good projects: Yuvika
257.article_body: Actress Yuvika Chaudhary said that she did 17-18 films after 'Om Shanti Om' but because she did not have guidance, she left a few "very good projects". "When you have no guidance in life or no godfather, it is a little different as you end up signing films. Then you feel you shouldn't have," she added.

258.title: Fire breaks out at SDMC scrapyard in Delhi, 12 fire tenders deployed
258.article_body: A fire broke out at a South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) scrapyard in Swami Nagar district park on Wednesday. No casualties have been reported, the fire department said. "We received a call around 3:45 am. 12 fire tenders were on the operation...around 4:25 am, it was marked as an A-4 category...it upgraded to A-6 around 4:55 am," an official said.

259.title: Karachi suicide bomber had master's degree, was mother of 2 and wife of dentist
259.article_body: Baloch Liberation Army has identified the Karachi bomber as 30-year-old Shaari Baloch or Bramsh, saying she was the group's first female bomber. She had a master's in Zoology, was pursuing MPhil and was working as a science teacher in a secondary school. Further, Afghan journalist Bashir Ahmad Gwakh said Baloch has two kids and her husband is a dentist.

260.title: Amber Heard suffers from 2 personality disorders, says psychologist hired by Depp
260.article_body: Psychologist Dr Shannon Curry, who was hired by Johnny Depp's legal team, told the court that Amber Heard suffers from borderline and histrionic personality disorders. Curry said Heard "externalises blame" and can be "self-righteous", "judgemental" and has anger. She added that people with such disorders "make threats using the legal system, threaten to file for a restraining order, claim abuse".

261.title: Amber didn't have PTSD, she exaggerated she had 19 of 20 major symptoms: Psychologist
261.article_body: While testifying in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, psychologist Dr Shannon Curry said that Amber didn't have post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). She further suggested that Amber "grossly exaggerated" that she had 19 out of 20 of the major symptoms for PTSD. "That’s not typical of even somebody with the most disabling form of PTSD," Curry said.

262.title: Govts under BJP's control practising politics of hate: 108 ex-bureaucrats to PM
262.article_body: Stating that governments under BJP's control are "assiduously practising politics of hate", 108 ex-bureaucrats, in a letter to PM Narendra Modi, wrote, "It's our fond hope that in this year of 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav'...you will call for an end to it." "The idea of India that our founding fathers had envisioned...needs a climate of...communal harmony to thrive," they said.

263.title: Both Anil Deshmukh, Nawab Malik have been framed: Sanjay Raut
263.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that whether it’s former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh or Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik, both have been "framed". "The Chandiwal Commission has submitted the report to the government. I have not seen it but we are saying from the beginning that the accusations are false," Raut added.

264.title: Russia to halt gas supplies to Poland & Bulgaria
264.article_body: Russian energy firm Gazprom has told Poland and Bulgaria that it'll stop supplying gas to the two countries from Wednesday. It comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin demanded "unfriendly'' countries to pay Gazprom in rubles instead of other currencies after sanctions were levied against his nation over the Ukraine invasion. Both Poland and Bulgaria have refused to pay in rubles.

265.title: Mumbai Police Commissioner wants to join Shiv Sena: Kirit Somaiya
265.article_body: BJP's Kirit Somaiya alleged that Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey ordered a police officer not to register his FIR as he wants to join Shiv Sena after 1.5 months. "We will go to Governor soon and if necessary also to HC to discuss this matter," Somaiya said. On Sunday, Somaiya had alleged that he was attacked by Shiv Sena's "gundas".

266.title: Feroz got angry if someone goofed up, gave them money at night: Writer Suparn
266.article_body: Writer Suparn Varma said that late actor Feroz Khan used to get angry if someone goofed up on set and would give the person an earful. "But he would...call the same person to his suite at night...give him bottle of Black Label, money...and make him feel good," Suparn said. He added the actor loved and hated in equal measure.

267.title: AMD Days Sale is now live on Flipkart
267.article_body: AMD announced AMD Days Sale on Flipkart featuring offers on laptops, desktops, and AIOs for casual, enthusiast, professional gamers, students, and working professionals. The sale will be live on 27th-28th April for customers to get extra ₹1,000 off on prepaid orders and up to 12 months of No Cost EMI on a range of laptops powered by AMD Ryzen™ processors.

268.title: RR have shown faith in me, I'm paying them back: Riyan Parag
268.article_body: RR all-rounder Riyan Parag, who was named Man of the Match for his performance against RCB, has said that he's paying RR back "bit by bit" for showing faith in him for the last three years. "A bit of satisfaction...I love pressure and I'm just showcasing my abilities," he added. Riyan scored unbeaten 56 runs to help RR post 144/8.

269.title: DTC bus catches fire near Delhi's Shanti Van; 3rd such incident in a month
269.article_body: A Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus caught fire near Shanti Van on Tuesday, making it the third such incident in a month. The fire took place in the rear portion of a non-air-conditioned bus that runs from Nand Nagri Depot. "The exact cause is not yet known," a DTC official said. No casualties were reported in the incident.

270.title: Mumbai Police files charge-sheet against IPS officer in phone tapping case
270.article_body: Mumbai Police on Tuesday filed a charge-sheet of around 700 pages against IPS officer Rashmi Shukla in connection with the phone tapping case. Shukla, who was the head of Maharashtra's State Intelligence Department (SID), had allegedly tapped the phones of Nationalist Congress Party's Eknath Khadse and Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut. Khadse's phone was tapped for 67 days in 2019.

271.title: 10-year-old killed as truck rams into 2-wheeler on Pune-Mumbai highway
271.article_body: A truck rammed into a two-wheeler on the old Pune-Mumbai highway on Sunday morning at around 10 am, killing a 10-year-old boy. According to Police Sub-Inspector Sawankumar Waghmare, the incident took place when the minor was heading to his mother's house with his grandfather on an Activa. Police have arrested the 26-year-old truck driver, identified as Indrajit Kumar Sanket.

272.title: CAA doesn’t take away rights of any Indian citizen: MHA
272.article_body: The Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) does not apply to Indian citizens so, it does not in any way take away or abridge the rights of any Indian citizen, the MHA said in its latest Annual Report for 2020-21. "The CAA is a limited and narrowly tailored legislation…It is a compassionate and ameliorative legislation," the report stated.

273.title: Mali accuses France of spying after video of mass burials emerge
273.article_body: Mali's military junta has accused the French forces of spying after the latter released a video showing mass burials allegedly being carried out at a grave by Russian mercenaries. The Mali government said that the French illegally flew a drone in its territory to spy. It added that the French were trying to hold Mali forces responsible for civilian killings.

274.title: Angry about his daily drinking, Delhi man stabs brother to death
274.article_body: A 32-year-old man allegedly killed his brother after being fed up of his alcohol addiction in Delhi, police said. The man killed his brother by stabbing him in the chest with a knife. Police said that he was angry with his brother because of the latter's daily drinking and the two used to fight with each other regularly.

275.title: Donors pledge $1.4 billion after UN’s hunger warning for Horn of Africa
275.article_body: Soon after UN aid chief Martin Griffiths warned that over 20 lakh children are at risk of starvation in the Horn of Africa, donors pledged around $1.4 billion for humanitarian and development assistance. "Let's not lose the sense of urgency to act," said Griffiths, thanking the donors for their "generosity and solidarity".

276.title: It's a game of confidence, we'll continue to back him: Du Plessis on Kohli's form
276.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form in the ongoing IPL season, RCB captain Faf Du Plessis said "great players go through phases" and they'll continue to back him to turn it around. On Kohli opening their innings against RR, Plessis stated, "We wanted [Kohli] to get in straightaway so that he doesn't sit on the sidelines and think about the game."

277.title: If Bezos can afford $500 mn yacht, he can give decent wages: Sanders
277.article_body: US Senator Bernie Sanders took to Twitter to comment on Amazon's Jeff Bezos and said, "If Jeff Bezos can afford a $500 million yacht and fancy multimillion-dollar homes all over the world...He can afford to pay workers at Amazon decent wages." He added that the workers can also be given "decent benefits" and "good working conditions".

278.title: Soft power has to be complemented by hard power: Anurag Thakur
278.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that soft power has to be complemented by hard power to become a strong nation. "Any nation requires hard power to stay relevant, and to exist beyond boundaries, a nation needs to have soft power," he added. "In last few decades, India is emerging as hard power and expanding soft power through cinema," he said.

279.title: Been told BJP is paying poor Muslim boys for stone pelting: Digvijaya
279.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh said that he has been told that some poor Muslim boys are being paid by workers of the Bharatiya Janata Party for stone pelting. "These are not facts so I am not accusing anyone. I'm checking the information and will then speak," the Congress leader said in a video.

280.title: Singapore executes 34-year-old mentally challenged Indian-origin man in drugs case
280.article_body: Nagaenthran Dharmalingam, a 34-year-old mentally challenged Indian-origin Malaysian man convicted in a drug trafficking case, was  on Wednesday executed in Singapore. Nagaenthran's lawyers have said his IQ was found to be 69, a level recognised as an intellectual disability. In 2009, Nagaenthran was caught crossing into Singapore from Malaysia with about 43 grams heroin strapped to his thigh.

281.title: Frenzy of hate filled destruction in India; your silence is deafening: Ex-bureaucrats to PM
281.article_body: In a letter to PM Narendra Modi, 108 ex-bureaucrats wrote, "We are witnessing a frenzy of hate filled destruction in the country where at the sacrificial altar are not just Muslims and members of the other minority communities but the Constitution itself." "Your silence, in the face of this enormous societal threat, is deafening," they said.

282.title: Man City score fastest goal in a Champions League semi-final, defeat Real Madrid 4-3
282.article_body: Manchester City defeated Real Madrid 4-3 in first leg of Champions League semi-final. Kevin De Bruyne opened the scoring for Manchester City after 93 seconds, recording the fastest-ever goal scored in a Champions League semi-final. Gabriel Jesus, Phil Foden and Bernardo Silva scored the other goals for City. Karim Benzema scored twice for Real Madrid, while Vinícius Júnior netted one.

283.title: We had trust and real belief in him: Samson on Riyan's 56*(31) vs RCB
283.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson praised Riyan Parag for his performance against RCB as they won by 29 runs. "We had real belief and trust in Riyan. We've been backing him for the last three-four years and he just showed it to the world," stated Samson. Riyan came in to bat when RR were 68/4 and helped them post 144/8.

284.title: India reports 2,927 new COVID-19 cases, 17.8% rise in daily cases
284.article_body: India has reported 2,927 COVID-19 cases, 2,252 recoveries and 32 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,483 COVID-19 cases and 1,399 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 16,279, while the death toll rose to 5,23,654.

285.title: Twitter tracking how many new hires turn down job offers due to fears over Musk: Report
285.article_body: Managers responsible for hiring at Twitter have been asked to keep track of how many prospective employees turn down job offers because of fears about Elon Musk, according to internal communications reviewed by The New York Times. Employees at Twitter also fear that Musk might end the company's flexibility about returning to the office, the report said.

286.title: Twitter's top lawyer cried in meeting over Elon Musk takeover, claims report; Musk reacts
286.article_body: Twitter's General Counsel Vijaya Gadde cried in a meeting expressing concerns over Elon Musk's takeover, a report claimed. Reacting to it, Musk tweeted, "Suspending...Twitter account of...major news organization for publishing a truthful story was obviously incredibly inappropriate." Musk referred to Twitter banning an article about US President Joe Biden's son Hunter's overseas business dealings.

287.title: India’s first DSML program with 80+ real business cases: Scaler
287.article_body: Scaler has announced its Data Science & Machine Learning (DSML) program as India's first to include 80+ real business case studies. The curriculum is designed in partnership with top tech companies, taught by industry experts & mentored by tech pioneers, it added. The program offers learners a hands-on learning experience to solve real-world business problems, regardless of their coding experience.

288.title: 4 more SDPI workers arrested in RSS leader murder case in Kerala
288.article_body: Kerala Police on Tuesday arrested four more workers of the Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) in connection with the RSS leader SK Srinivasan murder case in Palakkad. Two of them prepared the hit list of RSS leaders and later zeroed in on Srinivasan, police said. The total arrests in the case have now increased to 13, police added.

289.title: Tamil Nadu to provide 50,000 free power connections to farmers: Minister
289.article_body: Tamil Nadu government will provide 50,000 free agriculture service connections to farmers in 2022-23, state Electricity Minister V Senthilbalaji said. The move will not only help to enhance productivity but also expand the acreage under cultivation leading to farmers' welfare, he added. DMK government provided one lakh agriculture service connections in less than a year during 2021-22.

290.title: Musk barred from disparaging Twitter when tweeting on $44-bn deal
290.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has been barred from disparaging Twitter or its representatives while tweeting about his $44-billion deal to buy the platform, a new securities filing showed. The filing has details of the transaction, including a section on "public announcements". Musk is still allowed to discuss the deal on Twitter if he follows the condition on his tweets.

291.title: Tolerance inbuilt in Indian democracy: Pradhan on Hanuman Chalisa issue
291.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said tolerance is inbuilt in the Indian democracy. His remark came while he was speaking about the recent issue over Hanuman Chalisa’s recital. "In our country, tolerance is spoken about and written about. Sometimes, we also receive suggestions on it from abroad but I feel that it is in-built in our democracy," Pradhan added.

292.title: Elon Musk explains what he meant by 'free speech for Twitter'
292.article_body: After he struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Elon Musk explained, "By 'free speech', I simply mean that which matches the law. I am against censorship that goes far beyond the law. If people want less free speech, they will ask government to pass laws to that effect," he tweeted.

293.title: Ambala ex-councillor’s wife held weeks after escaping police custody in NDPS case
293.article_body: Police arrested ex-independent councillor Rajesh Kumar’s wife on Monday, weeks after she allegedly escaped from police custody amid an attack on a police team in Ambala Cantonment’s Deha Colony. The accused woman has been booked under multiple drug-related cases. A police team had on April 6 raided the ex-councillor’s house looking to arrest the woman in an NDPS case.

294.title: Trying to board crowded local train not 'criminal act': Bombay HC
294.article_body: Hearing the case of an 80-year-old man, who fell from an overcrowded local train, the Bombay High Court said that "calculated risk of boarding overcrowded local train will not amount to criminal act" under the Railways Act. The HC directed Western Railway to compensate the man with ₹1.5 lakh for his loss and ₹1.61 lakh for his actual medical expenses.

295.title: Tried therapy but it didn't work; I couldn't open up: Ajay on mental health
295.article_body: Ajay Devgn revealed he's an introverted person and said he can't open up to people. He added that it's one of the problems he doesn't like about himself. The actor also revealed he tried therapy but it didn't work for him as he still couldn't open up. However, Ajay said, he tries to sort things out in his own head.

296.title: 55-year-old woman resists knife attack by robbers in Pune, injured
296.article_body: A 55-year-old woman was injured when she tried to resist knife attack by one of five robbers who broke into her house on Sunday in Pune. Robbers held her and her 60-year-old husband at knifepoint and robbed her of mangalsutra and gold earrings. When they asked for more valuables, woman resisted, following which, one of them tried to attack her.

297.title: Arrest warrant issued against ex-BJP official in K’taka SI exam scam
297.article_body: Karnataka Police has issued a non-bailable warrant against former President of the BJP women's unit in Kalaburagi, Divya Hagaragi, in connection with cheating during the recruitment exam for Sub-Inspectors. Hagaragi runs a school, which was an exam centre, where candidates were helped in cheating to score high marks. Her husband Rajesh Hagaragi and three teachers were earlier arrested.

298.title: Pregnant woman pushed, abused on Mumbai local train; accused booked
298.article_body: A pregnant woman was pushed and abused by a fellow passenger in a Mumbai local train on Monday. According to police, the victim had boarded the first-class ladies coach and amidst the crowd, she mistakenly hit another woman. The accused woman then grabbed the back of the victim's clothes and began shoving her while verbally abusing her, police said.

299.title: Our morals gelled together, it was taken for granted we'll marry: Ajay on Kajol
299.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said that he and actress Kajol started seeing each other without any proposal and that it was taken for granted they will marry. He further said that their thoughts were similar and that their morals gelled together. "It just went in a flow," he added. He also said that there are ups and downs in every marriage.

300.title: BMC conducts pre-monsoon survey, spots 337 dilapidated buildings
300.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has identified 337 dilapidated buildings across Mumbai in its pre-monsoon survey, down from 465 last year. The most dilapidated buildings (163) are in western suburbs, followed by 104 in eastern suburbs and 70 in the island city, data showed. The survey is conducted to prevent loss of life and property in case of building collapse.

301.title: Bengaluru reports 82 of Karnataka's 85 new COVID-19 cases
301.article_body: Karnataka on Tuesday recorded 85 new COVID-19 cases and zero coronavirus-related deaths. Of the total cases, 82 infections were reported from Bengaluru alone. The city also reported 66 recoveries during the same period. The number of active cases in Bengaluru now stands at 1,626 with a positivity rate of 2.36%, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP).

302.title: Cocaine worth ₹11.57 cr seized from Tanzanian national at Hyd airport
302.article_body: Cocaine weighing 1.157 kilograms worth ₹11.57 crore was seized from a Tanzanian national at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. The passenger had arrived from Johannesburg via Dubai. "When enquired, he revealed...he had swallowed capsules containing cocaine...passenger purged 22 capsules at the airport and sought immediate medical assistance," Directorate of Revenue Intelligence said.

303.title: Probe into custodial death of Unnao vegetable vendor not fair: SC
303.article_body: The Supreme Court has said that the probe into the alleged custodial death of a vegetable vendor, Mohd Faizal, in UP's Unnao last year "cannot be said to be fair and impartial". The court said that it had the option to transfer the case to CBI, however, ordered a senior police officer from Lucknow to personally undertake further investigation.

304.title: 11 killed, 15 injured after temple chariot comes in contact with live wire in TN
304.article_body: At least 11 people including children died and 15 others were injured after electrocution during a chariot procession at Appar temple in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur district on Wednesday, police said. The chariot was at a bending, trying to turn when it faced some obstacle and reversed. While reversing, it came in contact with overhead line and went up in flames.

305.title: Kohli far from hitting good form, RCB might look to give him a break: RP Singh
305.article_body: Ex-India cricketer RP Singh has said RCB might consider giving a break to Virat Kohli if he fails to score in the next couple of matches. "He is a big player no doubt, but it must be said that he is not in form...he's far away from hitting good form," Singh stated. Kohli got out after scoring 9(10) against RR.

306.title: Be wary of parties trying to divide people on caste, communal lines: KCR
306.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao (KCR) on Tuesday said that people should be wary of the political parties that are trying to "divide" on caste and communal lines. "India is a great nation which treats people of all communities, castes and religions equally. If this harmony is disturbed, we would be lost forever," Rao added.

307.title: Tesla loses $126 billion in value amid Musk Twitter deal funding concerns
307.article_body: Tesla lost $126 billion in value amid investor concerns that CEO Elon Musk may have to sell shares to fund his $21 billion equity contribution to his $44 billion buyout of Twitter. Tesla isn't involved in Twitter deal, however its shares have been targeted by speculators after Musk declined to disclose where his cash for the acquisition is coming from.

308.title: RCB's Harshal Patel refuses to shake hands with RR's Riyan Parag, video goes viral
308.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel refused to shake hands with RR all-rounder Riyan Parag after the conclusion of their IPL 2022 match on Tuesday. Harshal was seen ignoring Parag and walking past him when players were greeting each other. Earlier in the match, the duo got involved in a verbal fight after Parag hit 18 runs off Harshal's over.

309.title: China's DJI to halt Russia, Ukraine sales to see products not used in war
309.article_body: Chinese drone maker DJI Technology will temporarily suspend business in Russia and Ukraine to ensure its products are not used in the war. "DJI abhors any use of our drones to cause harm, and we are temporarily suspending sales in these countries," DJI said. Ukrainian officials and citizens have accused DJI of leaking data on the Ukrainian military to Russia.

310.title: Man sets his Ola e-bike on fire over battery charge issue in TN; shares video
310.article_body: A man poured petrol on his Ola e-bike and set it on fire in Tamil Nadu over battery charge issue. The man named Prithv Raj posted video of the burning e-bike on Twitter. He had earlier shared the screenshot of the email that he sent to Ola Electric customer care. "Regarding sudden drop in charge," the email's subject read.

311.title: Gurugram reports over 400 COVID-19 cases in single day since February 10
311.article_body: Gurugram on Tuesday reported 409 new COVID-19 cases and 334 recoveries following which the number of active cases in the district went up to 1,380, as per the health bulletin. The last time Gurugram reported over 400 new COVID-19 cases was on February 10 with 413 cases. Gurugram's COVID-19 positivity rate on Tuesday stood at 10.47%.

312.title: 250 inmates of Pune jail to get loans under Maha bank's scheme
312.article_body: The Maharashtra State Co-operative Bank (MSCB) will start a loan scheme for prisoners from Yerawada jail. Under the first phase of the scheme, 250 prison inmates will be getting loans, following which, the scheme will be extended to other prisons in the state. The chairman of the bank said MSCB is first bank in India to give loans to inmates.

313.title: Germany to supply Ukraine with 50 Gepard anti-aircraft tanks
313.article_body: The German government on Tuesday said it will supply Ukraine with 50 Gepard anti-aircraft tanks amid its war with Russia. Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht said during a US-hosted defence conference at the US airbase in Ramstein that Germany will double its military support to Ukraine to €2 billion. Lambrecht added that Ukrainian troops will be trained on German soil.

314.title: RR defend lowest total in IPL 2022 against RCB, jump to top of points table
314.article_body: RR defeated RCB by 29 runs on Tuesday to record their third victory in a row in IPL 2022. With the victory, RR jumped to top of the points table. RR put up a total of 144/8 and went on to dismiss RCB for 115 in 19.3 overs. RR's 144/8 is the lowest defended total in IPL 2022 so far.

315.title: Utter abuse of law: Kumar Vishvas as he seeks to quash FIR against him
315.article_body: Calling the FIR registered against him by the Punjab Police as an "utter abuse of the process of law", former AAP leader Kumar Vishvas has moved the Punjab and Haryana High Court, seeking to quash it. Punjab Police filed an FIR against him on April 12 for making provocative statements against Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal.

316.title: PM to visit Assam to lay foundation stone for projects on April 28
316.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Assam on April 28 to lay the foundation stone for several projects including Veterinary College (Diphu), Degree College (West Karbi Anglong) and Agricultural College (Kolonga, West Karbi Anglong). The PM will also address a rally at Diphu in Karbi Anglong district, as per the Prime Minister's office.

317.title: After PMs meet on COVID-19, curbs to resume at airports: K'taka CM
317.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that precautionary measures at airports may be reintroduced after the Prime Minister’s meeting on COVID-19. "Depending on advisory from the Centre following the PM’s meeting with CMs tomorrow, all precautionary measures will resume at airports and border districts, especially those bordering Maharashtra and Kerala," Bommai stated.

318.title: Covid-19 cases on a slight rise, but no need to panic: K'taka CM
318.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that there is a slight rise in Covid-19 cases in the state, but there's no need to panic at the moment. The government has decided to make wearing face masks mandatory, he stated. "We will take steps based on the advice of the central government after meeting with PM Modi on April 27," he added.

319.title: US Open champion Raducanu parts ways with coach after 6 months
319.article_body: US Open champion Emma Raducanu has split with coach Torben Beltz six months after hiring him. "I feel the best direction for my development is to transition to a new training model with the (British tennis federation) supporting in the interim," he added. The 19-year-old reached career-high ranking of number 11 this week after reaching the quarterfinals at Stuttgart Open.

320.title: 'Hatti' community will be added in ST list by Centre: HP CM
320.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur said that Union Home Minister Amit Shah has assured that the Centre will include the state's 'Hatti' community in the Scheduled Tribes list. "The Hatti community has been demanding tribal status for long time. I met Amit Shah and discussed this...Hatti community will be given the status of tribal community," Thakur said.

321.title: Massive fire breaks out at Bhalswa landfill in Delhi; 4th such incident in a month
321.article_body: A massive fire broke out at the Bhalswa landfill site in Delhi on Tuesday, the fourth such large-scale fire in Delhi's landfill areas over the last month. Around 10 fire tenders are at the spot to douse the fire, officials said. "It's not yet known whether the fire was caused by methane generation or some human activity," an official said.

322.title: Your heart will obviously be racing: PBKS' Rishi on bowling to Dhoni
322.article_body: Talking about bowling to MS Dhoni in final over against CSK in IPL 2022, PBKS pacer Rishi Dhawan said everyone's heart will obviously be racing when the CSK wicketkeeper-batter is on the crease. "I knew that if I bowled two good balls, we would win the match easily...whole crowd was with him," he added. Rishi dismissed Dhoni at 12 runs.

323.title: Russia warns UK of 'proportional response' for provoking Ukraine
323.article_body: The Russian Defence Ministry on Tuesday warned of a "proportional response" if the UK continued to provoke Ukraine to strike targets in Russia. "Russian Armed Forces are in...readiness to launch retaliatory strikes with high-precision...weapons at decision-making centers in Kyiv," it added. Representatives of a certain Western country in Kyiv maybe harmed in these strike, it further said.

324.title: 8.3 million refugees expected from Ukraine this year: UN
324.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) on Tuesday said it expects around 8.3 million people to flee Ukraine this year following Russia's invasion. UNHCR spokesperson Shabia Mantoo said over 12.7 million have fled their homes in the past two months, including 7.7 million people displaced internally in Ukraine and over 5 million people that have fled Ukraine so far.

325.title: Bus carrying 35 people catches fire on MP highway, no one injured
325.article_body: A bus carrying 35 people suddenly caught fire while travelling on the National Highway in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district on Tuesday. Four fire brigades attended and all passengers were rescued, however, their luggage was reduced to ashes. The fire reportedly started after a bike kept on top of the bus started leaking petrol which then caught fire due to heat.

326.title: World Bank agreed to provide $600 mn in financial aid: Sri Lanka
326.article_body: The Sri Lankan President's media division in a statement on Tuesday said, "The World Bank has agreed to provide $600 million in financial assistance to address the current economic crisis." The World Bank would release $400 million shortly, it added. The crisis has led to a shortage of essential items in the country.

327.title: Paul Scholes labels Paul Pogba ‘a big disappointment’ at Man Utd
327.article_body: Former Manchester United midfielder Paul Scholes has labelled Paul Pogba as "a big disappointment" at the club. The French international is expected to leave when his contract expires at the end of this season. "I just don't think he's ever learned as a footballer, he constantly seems to make the same mistakes over and over again," Scholes said.

328.title: Nearly 6,000 foreign migrants detained in Mexico in 4 days
328.article_body: Mexico's National Migration Institute (INM) on Monday said nearly 6,000 foreign migrants were detained in Mexico in four days. The INM said the majority of the 5,688 migrants that were detained from April 21 to 24 were found in trailers, safe houses or hidden in truck cabins or bus compartments. Over 1,000 of the migrants detained were from Honduras.

329.title: Russia, Belarus banned from hosting international skating events
329.article_body: The International Skating Union (ISU) said Russia and Belarus will not be allowed to host international skating events following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The ISU had previously banned Russian and Belarusian skaters from participating in international competitions. The ISU added it is looking for a replacement host for the Rostelecom Cup that is scheduled to take place in November.

330.title: Man charred to death as car catches fire in Punjab's Faridkot
330.article_body: A 61-year-old man, identified as Harminder Singh, was burnt alive after his car caught fire in Faridkot, Punjab. "Harminder noticed a fire in his car as he approached Shahi Haveli restaurant. He pulled over on the side and tried to get out," a police official said. But due to fire, the doors were jammed and the driver could not escape.

331.title: 20-year-old girl abducted, raped by neighbour in MP's Ujjain
331.article_body: A 20-year-old girl was allegedly abducted and raped by a neighbour in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain in March following which a complaint was filed on Sunday, police said. The victim, a BCom student, was reportedly walking home when the accused offered her a lift. He then allegedly proposed marriage before taking her to an abandoned place and sexually assaulting her.

332.title: 190-year-old Charlotte Bronte book of poems sold for ₹9.6 crore, pic released
332.article_body: A tiny book of 10 unpublished poems by renowned English novelist Charlotte Bronte has sold for $1.25 million (₹9.58 crore) at the New York Antiquarian Book Fair. The book is titled 'A Book of Ryhmes by Charlotte Bronte, Sold by Nobody, and Printed by Herself' and is dated 1829. The poems were written by Bronte when she was 13.

333.title: 'Forever 21 lost out on $150 mn in online sales,' says parent firm; sues Bolt
333.article_body: Forever 21's parent company Authentic Brands Group (ABG) has sued American payments startup Bolt, alleging that the startup failed to deliver promised technology. ABG also said that during Bolt's integration with Forever 21, the clothing retailer lost out on over $150 million in online sales. Bolt called ABG's claims "a transparent attempt" to renegotiate the terms of the companies' agreements.

334.title: I once rejected Dhirubhai's tender & he had asked, 'Sarkar ki kya aukat hai?': Gadkari
334.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari during a News24 event said that he rejected Dhirubhai Ambani's tender for Mumbai-Pune highway while serving as a minister in Mumbai in 1995. Gadkari revealed, "Dhirubhai angrily asked me, 'Sarkar ki kya aukat hai? Aap kya road banaoge'." Gadkari added, "When Dhirubhai later saw the road's work...he was so nice...he told me, 'I lost, you won'."

335.title: Getting intimidated by Big B, Ajay would be my failure as actor: Rakul
335.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, on working with actors Amitabh Bachchan and Ajay Devgn in 'Runway 34', said that if she gives in to intimidation or nervous energy then it's her failure as an actor. The actress further said that she craves to do things with better actors, adding that doing so pushes you also to do better.

336.title: Russia expels 40 German diplomats in 'symmetrical response'
336.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry on Monday said it declared 40 German diplomats in Russia "persona non grata" in a "symmetrical response" following Germany's expulsion of 40 Russian diplomats on April 4. "We expected today's step, but it is in no way justified," German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said in a statement. Baerbock added the expelled diplomats had "not done anything wrong".

337.title: Telangana CM to introduce 11 resolutions on TRS' foundation day
337.article_body: On the occasion of Telangana Rashtra Samithi's (TRS) 21st foundation day on Wednesday, Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao will introduce 11 resolutions of its government. IT and Industries Minister KT Rama Rao said that the CM will release the vision and introduce resolutions. "We'll discuss how COVID-19 situation was dealt. Demonetisation and Centre's incompetence will be discussed," KTR stated.

338.title: US Vice President Kamala Harris tests COVID-19 positive
338.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris tested positive for COVID-19 on Tuesday but is asymptomatic and not considered a current close contact of President Joe Biden, the White House said. "She...will isolate and continue to work from the Vice President's residence," said Harris' Press Secretary, Kirsten Allen. Allen added that Harris would "return to the White House when she tests negative".

339.title: IGNOU has emerged as a modern-day Lord Hanuman: Dharmendra Pradhan
339.article_body: Addressing the 35th convocation of the Indira Gandhi National Open University (IGNOU), Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan called the university a "modern-day Hanuman". He said, "IGNOU has emerged as a modern-day Lord Hanuman in taking education and learning to the remotest corners and to the poorest." He also added that IGNOU should become the knowledge centre of the world.

340.title: Ukrainian farmers wear bulletproof vests to work in fields amid war
340.article_body: Ukrainian farmers in the Zaporizhzhia region have started wearing bullet proof vests while working in their fields amid the conflict in the country. The region borders the frontline of the military conflict with Russia. "We...put on our vests and...then go to fields. If there is shelling, we pack up and go to the office," a local farmer said.

341.title: Not worthy for a world champion: Mercedes’ Wolff after Emilia Romagna GP
341.article_body: Team boss Toto Wolff said Mercedes' W13 car this season is "not worthy for a world champion" after seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton finished 13th in the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix last Sunday. Hamilton's teammate George Russell finished in fourth place. Red Bulls' Max Verstappen won the race finishing ahead of teammate Sergio Perez and McLaren's Lando Norris.

342.title: Red Bull’s Verstappen wins Laureus World Sportsman of the Year Award
342.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen has been named the 2022 Laureus World Sportsman of the Year after winning his maiden Formula One world championship last season. Verstappen claimed 10 pole positions, 10 race victories and finished on the podium a record 18 times last season. Other F1 drivers to have won the award are Michael Schumacher, Sebastian Vettel and Lewis Hamilton.

343.title: Major fire breaks out in godowns in Pune's Kondhwa area
343.article_body: A major fire broke out in Parge Nagar in Pune's Kondhwa area, damaging five-six godowns before firefighters could extinguish the fire. "These are tin-shed shops located in close vicinity of each other. Shops include those selling furniture, automobile garage, vehicle body workshop, and so on. The cause of the fire is not clear yet," said fire station officer Sameer Shaikh.

344.title: Actress Tabu begins shooting for 'Drishyam 2', shares photo from sets
344.article_body: Actress Tabu has begun shooting for the sequel to her 2015 crime thriller film 'Drishyam'. Taking to Instagram on Tuesday, the actress shared a picture of clapboard, and wrote, "Day 1. Drishyam 2." The film is directed by Abhishek Pathak and will also feature Ajay Devgn, Shriya Saran and Ishita Dutta Sheth. The shooting is reportedly being held in Goa.

345.title: World no. 4 Rafael Nadal announces return from injury at Madrid Open
345.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal on Tuesday said he will return from his month-long injury at the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Madrid that begins later this week. Nadal, 35, suffered a stress fracture in his rib during the Indian Wells tournament last month where he last played in the final against Taylor Fritz on March 20.

346.title: There'a a set audience that's in to watch sequels: Tara Sutaria
346.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria in an interview has stated that she feels there is a set audience who loves the first part of films and would be in to watch its sequels. She further said that she doesn't think about commerce but about entertaining family audiences through her work. Tara made her debut with 2019 film 'Student of the Year 2'.

347.title: Russia removed as hosts of men's 2023 Ice Hockey World Championship
347.article_body: The International Ice Hockey Federation (IIHF) said Russia has been removed as hosts of the men's 2023 Ice Hockey World Championship that was to be played in Russian President Vladimir Putin's home city St. Petersburg. The IIHF said Russia was removed due to "concern for the safety and well-being of all participating players, officials, media and fans".

348.title: Kazakhstan Prez quits ruling party, transfers leadership to ally
348.article_body: Kazakhstan's President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev on Tuesday quit the country's ruling party Amanat and handed over its chairmanship to his ally Yerlan Koshanov. President Tokayev's move reportedly comes as part of his plan to make country's political landscape more competitive. Yerlan Koshanov is the current speaker of lower house of parliament and previously served as the president's chief of staff.

349.title: Actor Dhanush's first look from Russo Brothers' 'The Gray Man' out
349.article_body: Actor Dhanush's first look from his upcoming Hollywood film 'The Gray Man' is out. The film will be directed by Anthony and Joe Russo, who have also directed 'Avengers: Endgame'. 'The Gray Man' will feature 'Captain America' actor Chris Evans and actor Ryan Gosling in the lead roles. Actress Ana de Armas will also star in the film.

350.title: Delhi reports over 1,200 COVID-19 cases and 1 death in last 24 hrs
