350.article_body: Delhi reported 1,204 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, marking the fifth day of over 1,000 new cases in the city. The national capital also reported one coronavirus-related death on Tuesday, while 863 people recovered from the disease in one day. The number of active cases in Delhi now stands at 4,508, while the positivity rate is 4.64%.

351.title: Less than 1 malaria case per 1,000 population in MP: Minister
351.article_body: The current malaria infection rate in Madhya Pradesh has declined to below 1 case per 1,000 population, Health Minister Dr Prabhuram Choudhary said. He added that there was a drop of over 50% in cases between 2012 and 2020. He further detailed the government's strategies to curb malaria which included fogging, spraying chemicals, free treatment and awareness programmes among others.

352.title: UK to supply ambulances, fire engines to Ukraine amid Russian war
352.article_body: The British government said it will provide Ukraine with ambulances, medical supplies, fire engines and funding for health experts to help the country's emergency services amid its war with Russia. Over 40 fire engines have already been dispatched to Ukraine with rescue equipment, thermal imaging cameras and around 10,000 pieces of protective clothing.

353.title: No house arrest for Navlakha, will stay in jail: Bombay High Court
353.article_body: The Bombay High Court dismissed activist Gautam Navlakha's plea seeking transfer from Taloja Central Prison to judicial custody in the form of house arrest, as the jail lacked basic facilities. "The petitioner would be at liberty to bring to the attention of the presiding officer of special NIA court the grievances in respect of difficulties faced by him," court said.

354.title: 20 lakh children risk starving to death in Horn of Africa: UN
354.article_body: Nearly 20 lakh children risk starving to death in the Horn of Africa amid severe droughts, according to UN aid chief Martin Griffiths. Parts of Kenya, Ethiopia and Somalia are facing the driest conditions in more than 40 years. The UN has only a fraction of the $1.4 billion it needs to respond to the crisis, Griffiths said.

355.title: 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' earns over ₹900 crore worldwide in 12 days
355.article_body: Yash-starrer Kannada film 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' earned over ₹900 crore at the worldwide box office within 12 days of its release. Film trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan on Tuesday took to Twitter to share the numbers earned by the film. 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'  also stars Sanjay Dutt as the villain Adheera along with Raveena Tandon as the Prime Minister.

356.title: Declare your and family's assets: UP CM to Ministers, IAS officers
356.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has asked his ministers, IAS and IPS officers to declare all property owned by them and their family members within three months. He added, "All ministers should ensure that there is no interference of their family members in the government work. We have to set an example by our conduct."

357.title: Centre to grant ST status to Hatti community soon: Himachal CM
357.article_body: The Centre will soon grant the Scheduled Tribes status to the Hatti community, said Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur on Tuesday. "The Hatti community has been demanding ST status for a long time," he said. The community had a population of 2.5 lakhs as per the 2011 Census, which has now increased to about 3 lakhs, Thakur added.

358.title: Which COVID-19 vaccines have been approved for children today?
358.article_body: The Centre on Tuesday announced that India's Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation has given 'emergency usage' approval for children to three COVID-19 vaccines. Covaxin has been approved for children aged between six and 12. While Corbevax has been approved for children aged between five and 12, ZyCoV-D has been approved for those above 12.

359.title: Roger Federer to return to court in October, last played in July 2021
359.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer is planning to return to tournament tennis at Swiss Indoors in October. The event at Basel announced that Federer "has officially entered the tournament and will appear on the entry list with protected ATP ranking of number nine." The 40-year-old hasn't played since losing in Wimbledon quarterfinals in July 2021.

360.title: RCB's Harshal Patel involved in verbal fight with RR's Riyan Parag, video goes viral
360.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel and RR all-rounder Riyan Parag got involved in a verbal fight after the end of RR's innings. Parag hit Harshal for 18 runs in the last over of RR's innings. The duo were seen exchanging words while walking back for the innings break. Harshal was then seen being held back by a member of RR contingent.

361.title: Over 86% adult population fully vaccinated against COVID-19: Govt
361.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said over 86% of India's adult population has been fully vaccinated against COVID-19. "Way to go! Over 86% of the adult population is now fully vaccinated. Together, let's defeat COVID-19," Mandaviya tweeted. The Health Ministry also informed that India's COVID-19 vaccination drive has achieved the milestone of administering 188 crore doses.

362.title: Chernobyl radiation abnormal since Russian occupation: IAEA chief
362.article_body: During a visit to Chernobyl nuclear plant site on Tuesday, International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Director General Rafael Grossi claimed that the radiation levels in the area are abnormal. Grossi visited the plant on the anniversary of the world's worst nuclear disaster that took place there in 1986. The site was briefly occupied by Russian forces invading Ukraine.

363.title: Andhra man carries son's body on bike after ambulances charge ₹20,000 for 90 km
363.article_body: A man in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati was forced to carry his 10-year-old son's dead body on a motorcycle after private ambulance drivers at a government-run hospital allegedly demanded huge money ranging from ₹18,000-₹20,000 for 90 kilometres. The drivers also allegedly stopped another ambulance from carrying the body and attacked its driver. Meanwhile, police have arrested six drivers in the case.

364.title: '#leavingtwitter' trends on Twitter in India after Elon Musk buys the platform
364.article_body: Hours after Elon Musk announced that he was buying Twitter for $44 billion, '#leavingtwitter' began trending on Twitter in India. The hashtag was used in over 29,000 tweets, with tweets like, "Finally, it's out there: Twitter is an autocratic platform as Elon Musk buys Twitter #leavingtwitter." Several users also used the hashtag to troll people leaving Twitter over Musk's takeover.

365.title: About 15,000 Russian troops killed in Ukraine so far: UK’s Wallace
365.article_body: Britain's Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Monday said Russia's invasion of Ukraine which began on February 24 has cost the lives of about 15,000 Russian troops so far. He said that Russian armed forces have lost at least 530 tanks, 530 armoured personnel carriers and over 60 helicopters and fighter jets. Wallace added that he does not celebrate Russia's losses.

366.title: Sony Pictures officially announces Tom Hardy-starrer 'Venom 3'
366.article_body: The third instalment of the Tom Hardy-starrer 'Venom' franchise has been officially announced by Sony Pictures at the CinemaCon 2022. The first film in the franchise was released in 2018. It was followed by 'Venom: Let There Be Carnage', featuring Tom and Woody Harrelson. Tom's character Eddie Brock also had a cameo in Tom Holland's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.

367.title: I quit my corporate job to become an actor: 'Jersey' actor Saurabh
367.article_body: Actor Saurabh V Pandey, who recently starred in Shahid Kapoor's film 'Jersey', has revealed that he had a corporate job but he quit that to be an actor. "I knew it was a big risk in terms of my career...there were many rejections and endless auditions," he stated. Saurabh played the captain of the Punjab Cricket Team in the film.

368.title: Turkey lifts indoor mask mandate as daily COVID-19 cases drop
368.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan announced on Tuesday that wearing masks indoors will no longer be required. The move comes amid a drop in daily COVID-19 cases with 2,604 infections reported in the last 24 hours. Erdoğan, however, added that wearing masks at medical institutions and on public transport will remain mandatory till daily infections fall below 1,000.

369.title: Once we get going, KKR will be unstoppable in IPL 2022: Shreyas
369.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said his side would be "unstoppable as a team" once they get going in IPL 2022. "We are ticking all the boxes to get on to the field and win matches. It's just the execution part (where we are lacking)," he added. KKR have lost five out of eight matches, including four in a row.

370.title: Dalai Lama's Panchen Lama is leading a normal life: China
370.article_body: A young Tibetan chosen as Panchen Lama by Dalai Lama is leading a normal life as an ordinary Chinese citizen, China's Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday. "He and his family don't want their normal life to be disturbed," it added. The remarks come after the US raised concerns about the whereabouts of the man, who has been missing since 1995.

371.title: SEBI issues ₹2.05-cr recovery notice to ex-NSE official Subramanian
371.article_body: SEBI on Tuesday sent a notice to NSE's ex-Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian, asking him to pay ₹2.05 crore in a case pertaining to governance lapses at NSE. This comes after Subramanian had earlier failed to pay a ₹2-crore fine to SEBI. In the event of non-payment of the latest fine, SEBI may recover the amount by selling Subramanian's assets.

372.title: Dhawan has been a serious player: Shastri after Dhawan's 88* vs CSK
372.article_body: Ravi Shastri has praised Shikhar Dhawan for his match-winning 88*-run knock in his 200th IPL match against CSK. "He's seeing what the pitch had to offer...[and] what his role was," he added. "This man has been a serious player...he deserves all the accolades," he further said. On Monday, Dhawan became second player after Virat Kohli to score 6000 IPL runs.

373.title: Delhi HC directs AIIMS nurses on strike to rejoin work 'immediately'
373.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday directed the AIIMS Nurses' Union to ensure that its nurses, who are on strike, immediately rejoin work. The union had earlier announced an indefinite strike on account of the suspension of its President Harish Kajla, demanding its revocation and stopping of all kinds of retaliative measures against union executives of the main OT.

374.title: MP CM meets family of ragging victim who died by suicide, assures justice
374.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday met the family members of Chetan Patidar, a first-year student in Indore's Index Medical College who died by suicide last month. He assured the family of justice and said that people accused of ragging would not be spared. The family alleged that Chetan took the step after being harassed by senior students.

375.title: Ponting said 'I want you to play all 14 games' in IPL 2022: DC's Kuldeep
375.article_body: Recalling his first practice session with DC head coach Ricky Ponting ahead of IPL 2022, spinner Kuldeep Yadav said he loved the way the Australian motivated him as he hadn't played IPL in almost two years. "Ricky told me 'You are bowling well. I want you to play all 14 games. That's my approach. Don't worry about anything'," he added.

376.title: Will myself meet woman's family: NCW Chairperson on Dausa rape case
376.article_body: The National Commission for Women Chairperson Rekha Sharma on Tuesday said that she along with a team will go to Rajasthan's Dausa to meet the family of the woman, who was gang-raped and murdered. "The rape & murder of the woman is gruesome. Such incidents are repeatedly happening in Rajasthan," she said.

377.title: Prashanth & I have thought of a lot of scenes for 'KGF 3': Actor Yash
377.article_body: Actor Yash revealed that he and the film's director Prashanth Neel have thought of many scenes for 'KGF: Chapter 3'. "There are a lot of things which we couldn't do in 'KGF: Chapter 2'. So we know there are a lot of possibilities, a lot of kick-a** scenes are there," he further stated. "But it's just an idea," he added.

378.title: Central Railway to complete monsoon-related work before May 31
378.article_body: Central Railway (CR) General Manager AK Lahoti has directed officials to complete all monsoon-related works before May 31 to ensure smooth and disruption-free train services. He also instructed officials to ensure 24x7 monitoring of all vulnerable locations and to work closely with the state government and municipal corporations. CR has already de-silted 59 km of drains on its suburban section.

379.title: Hope SC will reverse laws applied to J&K after Art 370 abrogation: Mufti
379.article_body: Peoples Democratic Party chief Mehbooba Mufti said on Tuesday that she hopes SC will reverse all laws extended to Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) after Article 370 was repealed. Mufti's remarks came after SC agreed to hear pleas challenging the law used to scrap Article 370 in July. Centre revoked Article 370 and bifurcated J&K into two union territories in 2019.

380.title: Man's pic of Iftar on train goes viral, Minister says 'hope you had a good meal'
380.article_body: A man shared a picture of Iftar (evening meal during Ramadan) served to him on a train and thanked the Railways. Shahnawaz Akhtar said a pantry staffer asked him if he was observing 'roza' (fast) and he got the Iftar without asking. Union Minister Darshana Jardosh replied, "Indian Railways family is touched by your comments...hope you had a good meal."

381.title: Cong appoints late ex-Himachal CM Virbhadra Singh's wife Pratibha as state chief
381.article_body: Congress has appointed Lok Sabha MP from Mandi Pratibha Virbhadra Singh as President of Himachal Pradesh Congress Committee. Notably, Singh is the wife of late former Himachal Pradesh CM Virbhadra Singh, who was at the top post for 21 years. Moreover, Congress has appointed Mukesh Agnihotri and Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu as CLP Leader and Chairman of the Campaign Committee, respectively.

382.title: Bajaj Finance reports highest-ever net profit of ₹2,420 cr in Q4
382.article_body: Bajaj Finance reported its highest-ever consolidated profit after tax (PAT) of ₹2,419.51 crore in the January-March 2022 quarter, up 79.67% YoY from ₹1,346.64 crore. The company's net interest income for the quarter rose 30% YoY to ₹6,068 crore against ₹4,659 crore. Its assets under management grew 29% YoY to ₹1.97 lakh crore while new loans grew 15% to 6.28 million.

383.title: Restaurant shut down for preparing samosas in toilets for 30 years in Saudi
383.article_body: Authorities in Saudi Arabia's Jeddah recently shut down a restaurant after they discovered that it had been preparing samosas and other snacks in toilets for over 30 years, local media reported. It reportedly also used expired articles. The authorities said it has sealed off several illegal restaurants and more than a tonne of food stuff were confiscated and destroyed.

384.title: Delete my data published in public or I'll take legal action: Ola Electric customer to firm
384.article_body: Balwant Singh, who claimed his son suffered fractures and 16 stitches in his hands due to Ola Electric scooter's fault in Guwahati, has threatened legal action against Founder Bhavish Aggarwal. Singh asked Ola Electric to immediately take down his telemetry data published in public, allegedly without his consent. "Failure to do so, I'll take legal action against Bhavish," Singh tweeted.

385.title: China reports first human case of H3N8 bird flu
385.article_body: China has recorded the first human infection with the H3N8 strain of bird flu, the country's health authority said on Tuesday, adding that the risk of it spreading among people was low. A four-year-old boy was found to have been infected with the variant after developing a fever and other symptoms. No close contacts were infected with the virus.

386.title: FILA Philippines' 52-yr-old CEO found dead in Singapore, probe launched
386.article_body: Cris Albert, the 52-year-old CEO and owner of Philippines distributor for South Korean sportswear firm FILA Holdings, was found dead in Singapore on April 23. FILA Philippines confirmed her death in a Facebook post on Monday. Albert was found dead at Singapore's Fullerton Bay Hotel, and her death is being investigated by police as an unnatural one, as per reports.

387.title: 1st MP Auto Expo to begin in Indore on April 28, CM to attend on Fri
387.article_body: The 'Madhya Pradesh Auto Show 2022', which is being organised on a large scale for the first time, will begin on April 28. Various meetings and activities will take place at the three-day event which will be held at Indore's Super Corridor Square. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan and other cabinet members are expected to attend the event on second day.

388.title: 35-year-old MP jeweller dies by suicide after poisoning wife, sons
388.article_body: A 35-year-old man, who ran a jewellery shop in MP's Raisen district, allegedly died by suicide after poisoning his wife and two sons, aged 10 and 12. His younger son, however, survived and is currently in hospital. According to police, a suicide note was recovered in which the man mentioned financial losses in business as a reason behind the step.

389.title: Spain's King unveils 2.6 mn euros in assets amid transparency bid
389.article_body: Spain's King Felipe VI has made public his personal assets of 2.6 million euros (₹21.25 crore) for the first time. This comes ahead of a Spanish government decree that aims to make the Royal House more transparent. Notably, former King Juan Carlos had left Spain for the UAE in 2020 amid allegations of financial wrongdoing.

390.title: 4-year-old boy dies after being hit by car in MP, driver arrested
390.article_body: A four-year-old boy died after being hit by a car while playing outside his house in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Monday. The victim was reportedly dragged for around 20 feet as the driver sped up and tried to escape instead of stopping. Locals managed to catch him after he stopped the car at a distance and he was subsequently arrested.

391.title: Tourists sent flying after whale hits their boat off Mexico coast, video surfaces
391.article_body: A group of tourists were left badly injured after a humpback whale smashed into their vessel. The collision happened off the coast of Mexico when the boat was catapulted high into the air after it crashed into the whale. Local reports confirmed an investigation is underway to discover why the boat had not kept a safe distance from the whale.

392.title: Zareen Khan's mom admitted to ICU, actress asks fans to pray for her
392.article_body: Taking to Twitter on Tuesday, actress Zareen Khan said her mother was taken to a hospital on Monday night and added she had been admitted to the ICU. "My mom is very unwell again...Requesting all of you to please pray for my mom's speedy recovery," she tweeted. As per reports, Zareen's mother was admitted to the hospital last month too.

393.title: No one is punished for chanting Hanuman Chalisa: Sanjay Raut
393.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that no one was being punished for chanting Hanuman Chalisa. Accusing Devendra Fadnavis of misleading people on the Hanuman Chalisa issue, he said, "Trying to get inside someone else's home and destroying their peace is wrong." MP Navneet Rana and her husband were arrested after they threatened to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM's home.

394.title: Mathura unclean due to lack of sanitation mechanism: MP Hema Malini
394.article_body: Hema Malini, who is the BJP MP from UP's Mathura, said the city isn't very clean as crores of pilgrims visit it and there's a lack of mechanism for maintaining cleanliness. Malini, who was speaking at a public event in Gujarat, said, "I've tried and have been trying to change many things. Our (UP) CM Yogiji is helping a lot."

395.title: Install rainwater harvesting system or pay penalty: Indore civic body
395.article_body: The Indore Municipal Corporation has warned residents that failure to install rainwater harvesting system in buildings and commercial establishments by June 15 will invite penalties. Residential building owners can be fined up to ₹5,000 while it can go up to ₹5 Lakh for industrial units. IMC also stated that only treated water can be used for construction and vehicle washing.

396.title: BJP govt in MP couldn't even supply drinking water in 18 yrs: Cong
396.article_body: Congress on Monday criticised the BJP-led Madhya Pradesh government over its inability to provide clean drinking water despite ruling for 18 years. State Congress media department President Jitu Patwari claimed that over 10 lakh water taps were still dry. He further alleged corruption in water projects saying the government is pressurising contractors to buy pipes from three specific companies.

397.title: Cong MLA's son held for submitting fake papers to courts in rape case
397.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress MLA Murli Morwal's son Karan Morwal, who's been accused of rape, was arrested in Indore on Tuesday for submitting fake medical papers to courts. Karan forged documents while applying for anticipatory bail, claiming to have been admitted to hospital on day of alleged crime. He was previously arrested in case in October 2021 but released on bail.

398.title: 20 booked for attacking woman Sub-Inspector, constable in UP
398.article_body: Twenty people have been booked for attacking a woman Sub-Inspector and a constable when they were enquiring about a dispute in a village in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Tuesday. Superintendent of Police Prashant Verma said that on Monday SI Hemlata and constable Naresh had gone to Devin Tola in the Saraimira area when they were attacked by the locals.

399.title: Russian court orders seizure of Google's assets worth $7 mn: Report
399.article_body: A Russian court has ordered the seizure of 500 million roubles ($6.67 million) worth of Google's property and funds in Russia in connection with Google's restrictions on a Russian firm's YouTube channel, Reuters reported citing news agencies. The case concerns GPM Entertainment Television. News agency RIA reported that the court had rejected a previous claim by GPM on April 13.

400.title: Wimbledon defend ban on Russian and Belarusian players
400.article_body: Wimbledon had "no viable alternative" but ban Russian and Belarusian players from this year's Championships under the guidance provided by the British government, Chairman of the All England Club Ian Hewitt said on Tuesday. The decision was taken due to Russia's ongoing invasion of Ukraine which started in February. Notably, Wimbledon became the first major tournament to take this step.
